Requisition ID: 184695  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Is this role right for you?



 You will participate and influence the design decisions for banking digital experiences that touch millions of our customers every day.
 You will be engaged and partnered with many teams and designers, specifically elevating the visual UI/UX and interaction design to push the limits of what it means to create an impactful, engaging and beautiful experience.
 You will help enhance Scotiabank’s digital visual strategy across products, experiences and problem spaces.
 You will play a key role in helping set and refine the design quality bar, in partnership with other designers and design leadership, through our design principles and design system.
 You will understand our customers motivations and needs, leveraging rigorous design research and usability principles along with your intuitive design sense.
 You will consider customers interactions and journeys and act as an advocate for their constant improvement through accessible and inclusive design principles and implementation.
 You will partner and collaborate with Product management, Engineering, Marketing, Analytics, and other key players to envision and build products that make our customer’s experience useful, engaging, and effective while supporting our business goals.
 You will produce compelling visual deliverables to illustrate desired customer experiences and provide detailed specifications for software developers.
 You will be an active participant in our design community by providing feedback to your fellow Designers.
 You will practice empathy and the ability to actively listen and consider other people’s points of view.
 You will help to synthesize research outcomes into viable product experiences by supporting senior designers or the design research team on customer testing and insights into your design work.
 You will be self-driven and strive to build collaboration and communication skills with your colleagues.
 You will present and articulate thinking behind your work to key stakeholders, design directors and team members.
 You will perform in an open environment, striving to be persuasive and engaging while being self-driven.


 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?



 Post-secondary educational background in Design, Art Direction, technology or related fields
 2+ years of experience with an end-to-end product design background, specifically with refined visual design skills
 Exceptional attention to detail. You are a master of craft, composition, imagery, typography, iconography and color.
 A creative work portfolio that showcases an excellence in compelling ideas, problem solving solutions, collaboration, and visual storytelling.
 On top of current design and cultural trends. You follow the latest in design, music, art and tech.
 Extraordinary storyteller. You are an expert in bringing stories to life that are visually rich and are comfortable in pushing the medium to never-seen-before executions.
 Ability to work within the constraints of a Design System with flexibility, and a desire to push existing standards to the next level by contributing back to our Design System library.
 A demonstrable history of applying design thinking tenets and user centered design principles to design problems.
 Proficiency in the use of digital design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, etc.
 Strong understanding of Human-centred Design practices, including Design thinking methodologies, research, and user testing protocols, as well as Agile frameworks.
 An intermediate level of technical acuity on understanding front-end technologies, factoring it into your work limitations and constraints to understand when boundaries can be pushed.
 A positive and resilient personality with a growth mentality. You must be able to embrace feedback and have a desire for continuous improvement.
 Studies and/or experience in complementary fields to Product Design, like visual design, animation, research, data analysis, applied arts, writing and communications, etc.
 Bonus skills and interests: illustration, animation and/or prototyping software.

 What's in it for you?



 Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans.
 Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.
 Remote-friendly work environment will provide you with the flexibility to perform at your best.
 Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance.
 Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one.
 Dynamic Office - Fully equipped gym, showers, games room, bowling alley, micro market, free tea & coffee, universal washrooms, wellness rooms, and lots of space for team collaboration.
 Community Engagement - no matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons, contests, cooking with friends, Humans of Digital and much more!

Position: Premières nations/Métis/Inuits - Spécialiste du service à la clientèle, services commerciaux
Job Description:
Numéro de la demande: 185758  Joignez une équipe gagnante, engagée et axée sur les résultats qui évolue dans une culture inclusive et de haut rendement.

 Ce poste est affiché dans le cadre du Programme spécial de la Banque Scotia en vertu de la Loi sur l'équité en matière d'emploi et de la Loi canadienne sur les droits de la personne.
 Bien que vous deviez être une personne autochtone pour soumettre votre curriculum vitae, la participation est entièrement volontaire. Veuillez utiliser la définition ci-dessous pour vous assurer que vous êtes admissible et ouvert à l'auto-identification en tant qu'autochtone : 
Les peuples autochtones comprennent les membres inscrits et non-inscrits des Premières nations, les Métis et les Inuits. Seules les personnes autochtones résidant au Canada doivent s'identifier comme appartenant à ce groupe désigné.

 Objectif du poste
 Contribuer au succès global de la Banque commerciale au Canada, en veillant à ce que les objectifs, les plans et les initiatives individuels spécifiques soient exécutés et mis en œuvre à l'appui des stratégies et des objectifs commerciaux de l'équipe, tout en s'assurant que toutes les activités sont menées dans le respect des réglementations en vigueur, des politiques internes et des procédures.
 Le spécialiste du service à la clientèle apporte aux gestionnaires des relations avec la clientèle le soutien nécessaire pour répondre aux besoins de nos clients, qu'il s'agisse de clients nouveaux ou existants. Il devra notamment coordonner les efforts avec les partenaires internes et s'adresser directement aux clients pour la collecte/le traitement des rapports financiers, la satisfaction des besoins de financement, les besoins d'intégration et diverses activités telles que la résolution des problèmes remontés par les clients. Le rôle est spécifique au service de tous les segments de la banque commerciale. 

Le candidat est le champion d'une culture axée sur le client afin d'approfondir les relations avec les clients et de tirer parti des relations, des systèmes et des connaissances de la Banque dans son ensemble.
 En étroite collaboration avec les gestionnaires des relations avec la clientèle et les analystes du crédit, le spécialiste du service à la clientèle est chargé de fournir les services suivants à un portefeuille de clients existants et potentiels :


 Intégration : Contribuer à la collecte d'informations directement auprès des clients et de diverses sources, afin d'évaluer le profil de risque du client et de s'assurer que la Banque respecte ses obligations réglementaires. Il s'agit notamment de contacter les clients en s'appuyant sur des sources internes/externes/sites web, de consigner les informations dans la documentation "Know Your Client" sous différents formats, tels que les documents d'information sur le profil du client, et de répondre à divers groupes internes chargés de la conformité.
 Service à la clientèle : Soutenir / aider à résoudre les questions liées au service soulevées par le client directement auprès du gestionnaire des relations avec la clientèle. 
Tâches liées au crédit : contacter le client pour obtenir des rapports financiers et d'autres informations, le cas échéant, et veiller à ce qu'elles soient correctement documentées dans les systèmes et apporter un soutien général, le cas échéant, au processus d'examen annuel.
 Exécution : Coordonner les efforts avec le client, l'analyste de crédit, le gestionnaire des relations avec la clientèle et divers partenaires internes pour veiller à ce que le financement des prêts et les ouvertures de comptes commerciaux soient réalisés conformément aux attentes du client, en utilisant les modèles d'admission appropriés.




 Fournir des informations sur l'état d'avancement des diverses demandes d'exécution, d'intégration et de service et veiller à ce que les goulets d'étranglement ou les retards soient rapidement signalés et accompagnés d'un plan de résolution.
 Rechercher les opportunités de faire des suggestions pour améliorer continuellement les processus et les mesures de satisfaction des clients. Cela peut inclure la prise en compte des commentaires reçus directement des clients ou par l'intermédiaire de véhicules de satisfaction des clients.
 Comprendre comment l'appétit pour le risque et la culture du risque de la Banque doivent être pris en compte dans les activités et les décisions quotidiennes.
 Rechercher activement des opérations efficaces et efficientes dans les domaines respectifs, tout en veillant à l'adéquation, au respect et à l'efficacité des contrôles quotidiens de l'activité afin de respecter les obligations en matière de risque opérationnel et de risque lié à la conformité réglementaire. 
Favorise un environnement de haute performance et contribue à un environnement de travail inclusif.


 Qualifications

 Diplôme universitaire ou combinaison équivalente d'expérience offrant des compétences transférables
 Engagement fort en faveur d'un excellent service à la clientèle et capacité à travailler avec les clients pour résoudre les problèmes à l'amiable et dans les meilleurs délais. 
Solides compétences organisationnelles pour coordonner et hiérarchiser plusieurs demandes simultanées émanant de différents gestionnaires de relations. 
Solides compétences interpersonnelles dans un environnement d'équipe ; obtention d'un consensus, partage des compétences et du temps, coopération et coordination avec les parties prenantes internes et externes. 
Solides compétences écrites et orales avec une capacité avérée à impliquer les parties prenantes et les clients. 
Bonne connaissance des processus d'exécution et des rôles des partenaires 
Connaissance approfondie des logiciels et des plates-formes technologiques applicables au secteur commercial - exemples de ces logiciels ? 
Une connaissance pratique des caractéristiques et des avantages des produits et services commerciaux est un atout.
 Connaissance pratique des applications Microsoft Office 
Un haut degré de flexibilité et de curiosité pour s'adapter et apprendre une grande variété de tâches. 
Un engagement fort en faveur de l'exactitude, de l'orientation client et de l'obtention de résultats.


 Ce que nous offrons…



 L’occasion de rejoindre notre organisation diversifiée et inclusive et d’entrer en contact avec d’autres banquiers Scotia des Premières Nations, des Inuits et des Métis et leurs alliés.
 Une rémunération et des avantages sociaux compétitifs qui comprennent :
   
 10 000 $ annuellement dédiés à votre bien-être.
 Congé pour pratiques autochtones traditionnelles
 Programme de mentorat des employés autochtones
 Groupe de ressources pour les employés autochtones

 Une organisation engagée à faire une différence dans nos communautés – pour vous et nos clients.
 Vous pouvez vous attendre à être reconnu et récompensé pour vos performances élevées. Vous serez soutenu par la direction à travers des conversations de développement significatives qui permettent un avancement plus rapide et une formation interne pour soutenir votre croissance et votre développement.

Position: Customer Experience Associate- Ajax Main Branch (26.25 hours/week)
Regional Data: 314 Harwood Ave. S, Unit Hp05, Ajax, ON
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 188291  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.




 About the role


 As a Customer Experience Associate, you are the face, character and heart of our branches. Scotiabank is a place where we put our customers first, and our priority is to help them achieve their financial goals.
 Our Customer Experience Associates are people-centric and connect with customers in a relatable way. As an essential member of the Canadian Banking Branch network, the focus is to provide exceptional service throughout the customer’s journey by:

 Taking a proactive approach to discovering our customer’s needs and listening to understand what they are asking for
 Processing day to day transactions
 Nurturing rich, long-standing relationships
 Contributing to the Branch’s targets by identifying and fulfilling simple sales opportunities
 Being a technology expert and sharing your knowledge by introducing clients to our mobile banking applications and assisting them to better manage their banking needs


 Is this role right for you? In this role you will:

 Build strong customer relationships and deliver excellent customer service
 Uncover and solve customers’ needs
 Explain complicated concepts simply
 Demonstrate success in a target-based performance environment, as well as contribute positively to a team-oriented work environment
 Demonstrate an eagerness to learn and determination to succeed


 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if you:

 Have proven customer service skills through work or community involvement
 Are willing to assist in a professional, friendly and efficient manner
 Are available to work a flexible schedule
 Are comfortable in simple sales situations
 Have strong technical skills and the ability to promote digital and self-service banking options to our customers


 What’s in it for you?

 The opportunity to join a forward-thinking organization surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers
 A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional development
 Internal training to support your career growth and enhance your skills
 An organization committed to making a difference in our communities – for you and our customers
 You can expect to be recognized and rewarded for high-performance. You’ll be supported by leadership through meaningful development conversations that enable faster advancement and internal training to support your growth and development.
 A competitive compensation and benefits package

Requisition ID: 186775  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 As a Trust Associate in a Scotia Wealth Management Office, you provide proactive administrative and client service support to a Trust Officer and their account portfolio of varying size and complexity with the day to management, oversight and account administration for client, beneficiary and Co-Trustee relationships. While discussions with Co-Trustees, beneficiaries, clients, their advisors and the business community will generally be the responsibility of the Trust Officer, the Trust Associate will frequently deal with external contacts, gather and relay information and is designated as the point of contact in the absence of the Trust Officer. . Key Job Accountabilities Administration and Relationship Management Support

 Assist the Trust Officer with providing a best in class, proactive and personalized client experience to high net worth clients and beneficiaries, exemplified by timely and accurate account administration coupled with demonstrated technical expertise, personal integrity and an ability to respond to stated and unstated client needs and concerns.
 Provide effective back-up in the absence of the Trust Officer by demonstrating a detailed knowledge of the accounts and responding to the client and beneficiary needs in a timely manner, referring matters to other resources where appropriate.
 Maintain daily surveillance over cash positions and provide reports for any cash positions that require remedial attention. Create/input accurate and timely accounting entries for payments to third parties realization of assets, fee collection, referring all unusual items for further action as required. Prepare detailed fee calculations in Estate and Trust accounts in accordance with fee agreements or local judicial/industry practice
 Assemble information regarding assets in new accounts (including research into the tax costs) and ensure the preparation of the opening inventory/Record of Trust. Set up client and asset information on the Trust including the creation and maintenance of diaries to provide for such matters as fixed remittances fee processing, investment reviews and statement production.
 Prepare routine correspondence and documentation, including draft documentation in respect of matters that policy requires be submitted to the appropriate internal oversight groups concerning beneficiary/court approval of fees and statements;

  Additional Accountabilities

 Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
 Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
 Ensuring thorough knowledge of, and strict adherence to, the Bank’s Global Sales Practices.
 Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.

 Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.
 Skills Experience and Functional Competencies
 Proactive with a proven track record of providing a best in class client experience
 Proven aptitude to learn new concepts and readily apply them to day to day tasks
 Strong interpersonal and verbal communication skills
 Strong time management skills and a proven ability to multi-task
 Education / Experience / Other Information High School Graduate Enrolment in Financial Industry courses CSC, IFIC, STEP Canada, ICB. Working knowledge of asset management and administrative procedures Strong PC Skills: Basic knowledge of Trust Accounting principles

Requisition ID: 185058

 Dynamic Funds is a wholly owned subsidiary of Scotiabank, headquartered in Toronto. Dynamic Funds was established as a small investment club in Montreal in 1957, where it was a pioneer in providing professional investment advice to retail investors. Since then, we have evolved to become one of Canada's most recognized wealth management firms. We offer a comprehensive range of products and services, spanning every major sector, geographic region and investment discipline. Our financial solutions include open and closed-end investment funds, fee-based, tax-advantaged and customized high-net-worth programs

 “Pursuant to a language needs assessment conducted by Scotiabank, the successful candidate will be required to be able to communicate in English in addition to French because they will serve and English-speaking clientele.”
 This is a unique opportunity to discover the dynamic and ever-changing world of Scotia Wealth Management. Scotia Wealth Management receptionists welcome and interact with our affluent clients. It is therefore essential for them to have strong verbal and written communication skills. A professional image and good behavior are required for this front-line position. The successful candidate is well organized and has excellent time management skills, as well as a solid knowledge of Bank-related IT systems. Working hours are Monday to Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. The incumbent must possess exceptional communication, organizational and administrative skills, work independently and demonstrate strong judgment in problem solving.
 Main responsibilities

Serve all customers (including telephone calls) and respond to their needs or redirect them to the appropriate person, to ensure a response within a reasonable time.
Receive, sort and prioritize mail, taking into account action items and due dates, to ensure timely responses and action taken.
Perform daily mailroom tasks and ensure all documents or deliveries reach our internal employees correctly.
Accept packages and arrange courier service to ensure timely distribution of packages and documents.
Manage the receipt and processing of shipments and deliveries from head office.
Coordinate meeting rooms and conference calls ensuring action items and deliverables are discussed.
Coordinate all internal communications for staff, including updating internal documents, including telephone lists.
Organize and maintain various filing systems to track and store data and documentation and enable easy retrieval of information.
Manage the inventory of office equipment and supplies well and ensure that orders are placed on time.
Distribute office equipment and supplies and ensure all storage areas are properly stocked.
Participate in activities related to security and keyholder responsibilities, including producing access cards and opening and closing the office and cooperating with building security.
Pay invoices through our IT billing system
Take care of catering and business dinners, as needed.
Organize special events, as needed.
Communicate with office equipment suppliers to ensure equipment maintenance, as needed; including the supplier of the coffee machine.
Participate in special projects and other administrative functions, as required.


 Required Skills

Excellent customer service skills.
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Great organizational skills and proven ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
Effective communication and ability to develop good working relationships at all levels of the Bank and with clients.
Autonomy and ability to complete tasks with minimal instructions.

Position: Equity Research Associate, Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) - Calgary
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 189106  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 About the Equity Research Team: At Scotiabank, research is a key driver of our Global Equity platform. We specialize in the Canadian market, and we also supply targeted international research covering the United States and Latin America. Our top-ranked research team generates value-added equity ideas and themed publications. As well, we are constantly looking for ways to bring new products to market and provide clients with valuable research ideas and insights. Our equity research products include daily company-specific investment views, monthly and quarterly sector updates, in-depth fundamental research reports, portfolio analysis and recommendations, and equity strategy commentary.
 Purpose: Equity Research Associates enjoy a stimulating and demanding work environment. The Research Associate, ESG works closely with the Head of ESG Research to produce ESG publications and provide our clients with the insights they need to navigate sustainable investing using ESG factors. This position is based in Calgary.
 What You'll Do:

 Conduct in-depth ESG analysis and research using industry and financial sources
 Collect, consolidate, and interpret data
 Collaborate with sector-based research teams to produce ESG tearsheets and collaborative research
 Assist in writing research publications, including topical, theme-based research reports
 Follow overall market and ESG news and evaluate data to assess short- and long-term trends
 Prepare content and presentations for meetings with internal and external clients and conferences
 Communicate and handle enquiries from institutional investors
 Liaise with sales, trading, and other areas of the firm within regulatory guidelines

 What You'll Bring:

 A university degree in business, engineering, geoscience, environmental science or other ESG-relevant disciplines. Background in computer science also considered an asset.
 An MBA, Master of Finance or Environmental-Science related degree, CPA, or enrolment in/completion of the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) program is preferred
 Work experience in investment banking, equity research or ESG-relevant fields would be an asset
 Strong accounting, financial modeling, graphing, and analytical skills plus a creative mindset
 Experience using Bloomberg, FactSet, and Refinitiv
 Excellent command of Microsoft Suite, with an emphasis on Excel and automation capabilities
 Good business judgment and decision-making skills
 Ability to perform under pressure and meet tight deadlines in a team-oriented setting
 Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining a high standard of work
 A high level of energy and a keen desire to learn

 Work Arrangement: This position is currently an on-site role, with the expectation that you will work at least 4 days a week in the office. Please note that this is subject to change based on the needs of the business.
 Interested?
 If your experience is closely related but doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification, we do encourage you to apply - you might be the right candidate for this or other roles at Scotiabank!
 At Scotiabank, every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are and, embraced for their differences. That’s why we work to grow and diversify talent and engage employees in a performance-oriented culture.

 What's in it for you?
 Scotiabank wants you to be able to bring your best self to work – and life, every day. With a focus on holistic well-being, our many flexible benefit programs are designed to help support your unique family, financial, physical, mental, and social health needs.

Position: Conseiller Financier - Cote De Liesse & Lucerne, Montréal, QC
Job Description:
Numéro de la demande: 189369  Joignez une équipe gagnante, engagée et axée sur les résultats qui évolue dans une culture inclusive et de haut rendement.




 À propos du role


 En tant que conseiller des services bancaires, votre approche est axée sur les clients et vous êtes en mesure d’établir facilement des liens avec eux. Acteur essentiel du Réseau canadien de succursales, vous offrez un service exceptionnel tout au long du parcours des clients.
 Cette fonction vous convient-elle? Pour ce poste, vous devrez:

 être un passionné de la vente des services financiers et offrir aux clients des conseils financiers avisés;
 fournir aux clients des renseignements pertinents et des conseils d’experts;
 élaborer des plans financiers, mettre à profit les modules pertinents de l’outil de planification financière ainsi que des outils et des ressources liés à la prestation de conseils;
 comprendre l’importance d’une approche axée sur les résultats;
 avoir un niveau d’engagement élevé;
 adopter une approche collaborative lors des interactions avec les pairs, les clients et les partenaires;
 bâtir des relations en mettant l’accent sur la prestation d’une excellente expérience client et la croissance des relations avec les clients actuels.

 Avez-vous les compétences vous permettant de réussir dans cette fonction? Nous serions heureux de travailler avec vous remplissez les exigences suivantes:

 Expérience en gestion des ventes et capacité à commercialiser la Banque Scotia
 Aptitudes à bâtir des relations et à mettre l’accent sur la prestation d’une excellente expérience client et la croissance des relations avec les clients actuels
 Permis de vente de fonds communs et diplôme en planification financière du CIFP (ou un équivalent reconnu par la Banque) en voie d’obtention.

 Qu’avez-vous à y gagner?

 Vous bénéficierez d’un programme de rémunération concurrentiel et d’excellents avantages sociaux.
 Vous aurez la capacité de changer durablement les choses pour les clients.
 Vous découvrirez une culture inclusive où nous reconnaissons et récompensons les contributions des employés.
 Vous aurez la possibilité de faire partie d’une organisation qui s’est engagée à faire avancer les choses au sein des collectivités, tant pour ses clients que pour ses employés.
 Vous servirez une clientèle relativement aisée et aurez la possibilité de vous appuyer sur ce portefeuille pour interagir avec des clients ayant un potentiel de croissance.
 Votre parcours professionnel sera balisé clairement, avec transparence.


 Conformément à l’évaluation des besoins linguistiques effectuée par la Banque Scotia, le candidat retenu doit pouvoir communiquer en anglais et en français car il se peut qu’il serve une clientèle anglophone

Requisition ID: 188703  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 First Nations/Metis/Inuit – Customer Experience Associate 
Posted pursuant to Scotiabank’s Special Program under the Employment Equity Act and Canadian Human Rights Act.  While you must be an Indigenous person in order to submit your resume, participation is completely voluntary. Please use the definition below to make sure you’re eligible and open to self-identifying as Indigenous person:  Indigenous peoples include First Nation, Métis and Inuit people. Only Indigenous peoples who come from Canada should identify themselves as belonging to this designated group
 What your role will be…  At Scotiabank we help employees build their futures – where they can be themselves, and win together. With a commitment to diversity and inclusion and a performance-oriented culture that includes coaching, learning, and development – there are endless possibilities. At Scotiabank – you can make an impact. You help make the futures of our 25 million customers happen. You can find your future here.
 As a Customer Experience Associate, you are the face, character and heart of our branches. Scotiabank is a place where we put our customers first, and our priority is to help them achieve their financial goals.

 Our Customer Experience Associates are people-centric and connect with customers in a relatable way. As an essential member of the Canadian Banking Branch network, the focus is to provide exceptional service throughout the customer’s journey by:

 Taking a proactive approach to discovering our customer’s needs and listening to understand what they are asking for
 Processing day to day transactions
 Nurturing rich, long-standing relationships
 Contributing to the Branch’s targets by identifying and fulfilling simple sales opportunities
 Being a technology expert and sharing your knowledge by introducing clients to our mobile banking applications and assisting them to better manage their banking needs


 Is this role right for you? In this role you will:

 Build strong customer relationships and deliver excellent customer service
 Uncover and solve customers’ needs
 Explain complicated concepts simply
 Demonstrate success in a target-based performance environment, as well as contribute positively to a team-oriented work environment
 Demonstrate an eagerness to learn and determination to succeed


 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if you:

 Have proven customer service skills through work or community involvement
 Are willing to assist in a professional, friendly and efficient manner
 Are available to work a flexible schedule
 Are comfortable in simple sales situations
 Have strong technical skills and the ability to promote digital and self-service banking options to our customers


 What we’re offering…

 The opportunity to join our diverse and inclusive organization and connect with other First Nations, Inuit, and Metis Scotiabankers and their allies when joining our Indigenous Employee Resource Group.
 A competitive compensation and benefits package which include:
   
 $10,000 annually dedicated to your well being
 Traditional Indigenous Practices Leave
 Indigenous Employee Mentoring Program

 An organization committed to making a difference in our communities
 You can expect to be recognized and rewarded for high-performance. You’ll be supported by leadership through meaningful development conversations that enable faster advancement and internal training to support your growth and development
 You'll receive clear, transparent criteria to progress in your career

Requisition ID: 186775  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 As a Trust Associate in a Scotia Wealth Management Office, you provide proactive administrative and client service support to a Trust Officer and their account portfolio of varying size and complexity with the day to management, oversight and account administration for client, beneficiary and Co-Trustee relationships. While discussions with Co-Trustees, beneficiaries, clients, their advisors and the business community will generally be the responsibility of the Trust Officer, the Trust Associate will frequently deal with external contacts, gather and relay information and is designated as the point of contact in the absence of the Trust Officer. . Key Job Accountabilities Administration and Relationship Management Support

 Assist the Trust Officer with providing a best in class, proactive and personalized client experience to high net worth clients and beneficiaries, exemplified by timely and accurate account administration coupled with demonstrated technical expertise, personal integrity and an ability to respond to stated and unstated client needs and concerns.
 Provide effective back-up in the absence of the Trust Officer by demonstrating a detailed knowledge of the accounts and responding to the client and beneficiary needs in a timely manner, referring matters to other resources where appropriate.
 Maintain daily surveillance over cash positions and provide reports for any cash positions that require remedial attention. Create/input accurate and timely accounting entries for payments to third parties realization of assets, fee collection, referring all unusual items for further action as required. Prepare detailed fee calculations in Estate and Trust accounts in accordance with fee agreements or local judicial/industry practice
 Assemble information regarding assets in new accounts (including research into the tax costs) and ensure the preparation of the opening inventory/Record of Trust. Set up client and asset information on the Trust including the creation and maintenance of diaries to provide for such matters as fixed remittances fee processing, investment reviews and statement production.
 Prepare routine correspondence and documentation, including draft documentation in respect of matters that policy requires be submitted to the appropriate internal oversight groups concerning beneficiary/court approval of fees and statements;

  Additional Accountabilities

 Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
 Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
 Ensuring thorough knowledge of, and strict adherence to, the Bank’s Global Sales Practices.
 Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.

 Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.
 Skills Experience and Functional Competencies
 Proactive with a proven track record of providing a best in class client experience
 Proven aptitude to learn new concepts and readily apply them to day to day tasks
 Strong interpersonal and verbal communication skills
 Strong time management skills and a proven ability to multi-task
 Education / Experience / Other Information High School Graduate Enrolment in Financial Industry courses CSC, IFIC, STEP Canada, ICB. Working knowledge of asset management and administrative procedures Strong PC Skills: Basic knowledge of Trust Accounting principles

Numéro de la demande: 184161  Joignez une équipe gagnante, engagée et axée sur les résultats qui évolue dans une culture inclusive et de haut rendement.




 À propos du role


 Représentant des ventes (Montréal, Rive-Sud, QC)
 Nous recrutons activement des représentants des ventes pour Montreal/Rive-Sud, QC. Aucune expérience bancaire requise !
 Description du poste :
 En tant que représentant des ventes Montréal/Rive-Sud, QN, vous serez responsable de l'intégration des clients qui ont acheté un prêt hypothécaire par l'entremise de notre force de vente hypothécaire indirecte. Votre rôle sera d'approfondir les relations avec les clients par la vente de solutions bancaires.
 Ce rôle vous convient-il ?

 En tant que représentant des ventes (Montréal/Rive-Sud, QC), vous êtes déterminé à obtenir des résultats, vous êtes motivé, vous avez un sens aigu des ventes et vous aimez rencontrer de nouvelles personnes.Vous êtes prêt à travailler selon un horaire variable, y compris les fins de semaine et les soirs, et vous êtes disponible pour rencontrer les clients aux moments qui leur conviennent, en personne et virtuellement.
 Vous avez de solides compétences interpersonnelles pour gérer et établir des partenariats solides, tant à l'interne qu'à l'externe.
 Vous possédez et conservez un permis de conduire et avez accès à un moyen de transport personnel pendant les heures de travail.
 Vous avez les compétences qui vous permettront de réussir dans ce rôle ? Nous aimerions travailler avec vous si :Vous avez une expérience avérée de l'excellence dans un environnement de vente (dans n'importe quel secteur).
 Vous aimez relever le défi de dépasser les objectifs
 Vous avez une bonne gestion du temps, des compétences d'organisation et vous êtes autonome.
 Vous êtes un bâtisseur de relations qui s'attache à offrir une excellente expérience client et à approfondir les relations avec les clients existants et nouveaux.

 Quels sont les avantages pour vous ?

 Un environnement de soutien avec des coachs qui sont inspirés pour vous aider à dépasser vos objectifs.
 Des horaires de travail flexibles
 Les outils dont vous avez besoin pour réussir à fournir aux clients des conseils et des solutions de produits.
 Une rémunération lucrative comprenant un salaire de base et une rémunération trimestrielle, ce qui vous permet de contrôler le montant de vos gains.
 Un programme unique de génération de pistes, dans le cadre duquel nous vous fournissons des pistes de clients pré-approuvés pour générer vos ventes.

Position: Premières nations/Métis/Inuits : Analyste principal, Rapports sur la réglementation financière, enti
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 184184  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Posted pursuant to Scotiabank’s Special Measure Program under the Employment Equity Act and Canadian Human Rights Act.

 While you must be an Indigenous person in order to submit your resume, participation is completely voluntary. Please use the definition below to make sure you’re eligible and open to self-identifying as Indigenous person:

 Indigenous Peoples include First Nations, Métis and Inuit people. Only those Indigenous peoples who come from Canada should identify themselves as belonging to this designated group.

 Scotiabank provides extended benefits to Indigenous employees aimed at supporting and promoting their culture.

 Job Purpose
 The Regulatory reporting team manages and oversees financial regulatory reporting for the Bank and assigned subsidiaries. The Senior Analyst prepares and submits a subset of the team’s returns ensuring complete, accurate and timely completion in accordance with instructions provided by regulators as well as established procedures and deadlines.

 Accountabilities Regulatory Reporting Manage the production of assigned regulatory returns at the Bank and/or subsidiary level ensuring completeness, accuracy and timely filing of all financial reports with the Regulators (e.g., OSFI, Bank of Canada, Statistics Canada, CDIC), and keeping abreast of regulatory changes.
 Interpret and implement new reporting requirements and manage the implementation of system and procedural changes to ensure compliance with new regulatory requirements.

 Regulatory Reporting Target Operating Model (RRTOM) related activities Document business requirements for assigned returns, design test cases and monitor UAT for system implementation and participate in various types of testing

 Financial Reporting Manage the production of information for assigned financial statements notes ensuring that procedures and processes reflect the latest requirements and ensure adequate controls exist to validate the accuracy and completeness of the disclosures.

 Accounting and Other Initiatives Participate, as required, in accounting and other initiatives impacting financial regulatory filings, including new or enhanced systems, changes in accounting standards, new products or acquisitions and disposals SOX Compliance/Process Improvements As a SOX process owner for stated responsibilities, ensure strong process controls are implemented and documentation is prepared and updated regularly for Financial and Regulatory processes. On an ongoing basis, ensure processes are reviewed regularly and enhanced where required.

 Change Management: Embrace and drive change as required. Identify opportunities to improve efficiency and propose changes to the management.

 Other projects and initiatives as required. Manage ad- hoc projects as assigned by the management or other areas in the group


 Education / Experience / Skills required


Post-secondary education in a related discipline or equivalent experience is required
Pursuing an accounting designation and/or prior experience working in a regulatory reporting environment will be an asset
Knowledge of IFRS and financial regulatory requirements with strong understanding of financial and management accounting principles

Your natural curiosity and focus on improving things, which will lead you to identify new opportunities to maximize the customer experience.

Requisition ID: 189016  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 The Team

 Global Banking and Markets Engineering (GBME) is the fast-moving, award-winning technology engine that powers Scotiabank’s Corporate, Investment Banking, and Capital Markets businesses.

 The Role

 GBME’s Project Excellence Team is searching for a Technical Analyst Advisory to liaison between business stakeholders and internal engineering and architect teams, ensuring solutions are developed and delivered on time, efficiently and with high quality for various projects within GBME.

 The successful candidate will have a results-oriented and curious mindset with strong technical skills. You will work closely with cross functional teams, including engineers, solutions architects, and business teams to develop and implement market leading solutions that are scalable and deliver excellence, and value to our business partners and customers.

 As part of the role, you’ll



 Demonstrate an informed knowledge of business functions to resolve problems and capitalize on improvement opportunities.
 Ensure business specifications/requirements documentation is accurately prepared and comprehensive to support sizing/development efforts and as input to various project documentation.
 Develop and deliver Business Requirements Documents, Design Documents, Use Cases, and Process Models as required.
 Build out new features for applications, utilizing various functional testing frameworks and methodologies.
 Create and execute test cases, utilizing Behavioural Driven Testing Methodologies and Test Driven Methodologies.
 Use critical thinking to work through complex workflows, improving testing logic.
 Participate in the development of detailed project plans, the monitoring of progress against planned objectives, the financial review, and securing consensus and co-operation from users and senior management.
 Work closely across GBME technology teams during all stages of the system development life cycle and bridge the gap between business and technology sides of the solution.
 Liaising between the business community and the IT organization to provide technical solutions that meet user needs.
 Build relationships and communicate effectively with colleagues in Global regions.
 Support production issues and handle escalations during Release cycles as needed.
 Perform ad hoc project work on various GBME projects.


 Minimum Qualifications



 Proven ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications and deliver working results.
 Minimum 2 years’ working knowledge of databases such as PostgrSQL, with ability to create and run queries independently.
 Minimum 2 years’ experience creating automated test cases with Selenium, Cucumber, and other API Frameworks (Karate preferred).
 Thorough understanding of GUI processes, such as how developers utilize network tabs to understand GUI applications.
 Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
 A recognized undergraduate degree or diploma in business administration, computer science or related field required.
 Excellent working experience of Microsoft suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project).


 What's in it for you?



 Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans.
 Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences everyone brings to the Bank and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove, and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.
 Remote-friendly work environment will provide you with the flexibility to perform at your best.
 Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance.
 Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one.
 Community Engagement - no matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons, contests, cooking with friends, Humans of Digital and much more!

Requisition ID: 189048  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Purpose
 Join us and contribute to an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential. You will champion an inclusive environment to make Scotiabank the employer of choice for the diverse communities that we serve.

 Working within the dynamic Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) team, you will focus on driving inclusion for a performance-based culture by supporting the development and execution of the Global Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Strategy. Ensuring specific individual goals, plans, and initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. You have a proven record of accomplishment as a highly collaborative, organized and results oriented professional who can deepen strategic partnerships and leverage broader Bank stakeholders, systems, and knowledge. You are passionate about cultural transformation and driving organizational change, ensuring all activities conducted comply with governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures.

 Your professional skillsets and lived experiences will support the advancement of global DEI strategic initiatives that work to attract, develop, and retain diverse talent at Scotiabank.

 Your role will primarily focus on managing the Global DEI Sponsorship Program, with the intention to build the next generation of diverse leaders at the Bank through developing high-performing and high-potential employees. You will be the main point of contact and subject matter expert on the Enterprise DEI team for the Sponsorship Program and its’ Playbook of resources.

 You will partner closely with Business and Functional Lines stakeholders as they implement Cohorts of the Global DEI Sponsorship Program.
 
What you'll be doing...
 You will be responsible for supporting the Senior Manager, DEI with key initiatives supporting the Global DEI Strategy, with a primary focus on the Global DEI Sponsorship Program. You will also be responsible for supporting the advancement on inclusion of LGBT+ employees.

 Global DEI Sponsorship Program responsibilities will include:

 Act as the dedicated support person for the Global DEI Sponsorship Program and throughout the entire Program life cycle (i.e., initiation / planning, execution, & sustainment).
 Work closely with the Cohort Managers of each Business and Functional Line participating in the Program and join and present at Cohort Advisory Team meetings, when requested.
 Manage external vendor relationship through contracting, scheduling, and confirming invoicing with Business and Functional Lines.
 Provide monthly updates on Business and Functional Line-led Cohorts to the Enterprise DEI Team. 
Review Program guidelines and make appropriate recommendations to enhance Program effectiveness in consultation with the Cohort Advisory Groups, as necessary.
 Prepare Program status information updates to multiple stakeholder groups, including Inclusion Councils and executive Steering Committee, as required.
 Build and maintain solid, professional working relationships with peers within the Cohort Advisory Groups. Leverage these relationships to identify issues, make recommendations, and initiate resolutions.


 Initiation / Planning



 Provide guidance on the use of the Sponsorship Playbook to Business and Functional Lines interested in participating in the Global DEI Sponsorship Program.
 Aid with the Program’s needs assessment, when required.
 Support Cohort Advisory Groups through the Candidate Selection Process.
 Support Cohort Managers in creation of Cohort Sponsorship Program page on SharePoint.



 Execution



 Have regular touch bases with Cohort Managers to provide guidance on all aspects of the Program.
 Support Cohort Advisory Groups through the Participant Matching Process.
 Make recommendations for resolutions if issues are identified during by Cohort Managers during the Program.
 Review and incorporate feedback from Check-In Surveys into the Program design to enhance effectiveness, when necessary.



 Sustainment



 Enable completion flags on Participants employee talent and learning profiles on internal systems. 
Produce bi-annually reports that details retention and career movement of graduated Protégés for each Business and Functional Line Cohort.
 Manage the Global DEI Sponsorship Program’s Alumni Community Hub on internal social media platforms (i.e., Yammer, MS Teams, SharePoint, etc.).




 LGBT+ portfolio responsibilities will include:

 Support analysis and reporting dashboards, recommending opportunities for priority areas.
 Support the collection of data from Content Providers on awards and indices. 
Support updates internal social media platforms (i.e., Yammer, MS Teams, SharePoint, etc.).
 Other duties as assigned to contribute to the advancement of inclusion for LGBT+ employees.

 General responsibilities for all Bank employees:

 Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
 Actively pursue effective and efficient operations in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values and Code of Conduct.
 Champion a high-performance environment and contribute to an inclusive and equitable work environment.


 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? - We'd love to work with you if you have:

 Minimum 3 years working experience in DEI or a related field/experience.
 College Diploma or University Degree in Human Resources, Project Management, or Communications. 
Knowledge of DEI methodology and how to drive the cultural and behavioral changes needed to enable an inclusive environment in a high-performance work culture.
 Proven effective written and oral communication skills. 
Strong implementation/project management & organizational skills.
 High level competency with MS programs (PowerPoint, Word, and Excel).
 Intellectual curiosity around ‘best-in-class’ DEI practices (inside and outside of the Bank).
 Ability to translate strategy into actionable plans and results.
 Fluency in French and/or Spanish would be an asset.

Position: Customer Experience Associate - Tatamagouche, NS (30 Hours/ Week)
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 188744  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.




 About the role


 As a Customer Experience Associate, you are the face, character and heart of our branches. Scotiabank is a place where we put our customers first, and our priority is to help them achieve their financial goals.
 Our Customer Experience Associates are people-centric and connect with customers in a relatable way. As an essential member of the Canadian Banking Branch network, the focus is to provide exceptional service throughout the customer’s journey by:

 Taking a proactive approach to discovering our customer’s needs and listening to understand what they are asking for
 Processing day to day transactions
 Nurturing rich, long-standing relationships
 Contributing to the Branch’s targets by identifying and fulfilling simple sales opportunities
 Being a technology expert and sharing your knowledge by introducing clients to our mobile banking applications and assisting them to better manage their banking needs


 Is this role right for you? In this role you will:

 Build strong customer relationships and deliver excellent customer service
 Uncover and solve customers’ needs
 Explain complicated concepts simply
 Demonstrate success in a target-based performance environment, as well as contribute positively to a team-oriented work environment
 Demonstrate an eagerness to learn and determination to succeed


 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if you:

 Have proven customer service skills through work or community involvement
 Are willing to assist in a professional, friendly and efficient manner
 Are available to work a flexible schedule
 Are comfortable in simple sales situations
 Have strong technical skills and the ability to promote digital and self-service banking options to our customers


 What’s in it for you?

 The opportunity to join a forward-thinking organization surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers
 A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional development
 Internal training to support your career growth and enhance your skills
 An organization committed to making a difference in our communities – for you and our customers
 You can expect to be recognized and rewarded for high-performance. You’ll be supported by leadership through meaningful development conversations that enable faster advancement and internal training to support your growth and development.
 A competitive compensation and benefits package

Regional Data: 15190 North Bluff Road, White Rock, BC
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 186897  As a cornerstone business within Scotia Wealth Management®, ScotiaMcLeod has earned a reputation for integrity based on service excellence and trusted investment advice. Our advisors and teams pride themselves on exploring innovative approaches to protecting and growing their clients' assets.  When you join ScotiaMcLeod, you’ll be empowered to deliver Enriched Thinking®, a unique approach that incorporates your client’s thinking, as well as our thinking, to drive results. You’ll work with a team of specialists to deliver a client-centric approach to wealth management, enabling you to consider all the facets of your client’s life, family and business. With a focus on total wealth planning, and wealth specialists to help you deliver on this unique value proposition, you’ll be enabling clients to see not just the big picture, but all the little ones too.

 BRIEF INTRODUCTION
 As an Administrative Associate you will be responsible for contributing to the overall success of one or more Wealth Advisors by ensuring a high level of client service achieved by effective administration and day-to-day trading of their business.  IS THIS ROLE RIGHT FOR YOU In the role you will:


 Ensure effective client administration by managing all administrative processes and escalations requiring investigation
Consistently demonstrate high levels of client service by:
 o supporting the advisor in regular reviews of portfolios including entering client trades as directed by the client or Advisor and identifying client needs
   o responding to client inquiries, resolving issues and effecting client transactions in a timely and responsive manner
  

Provide marketing assistance by coordinating materials, events, and seminars to increase/identify opportunities to grow assets and/or revenue
Support the growth of the business by managing tracking reports for Wealth Advisors to review targets, recommendations, and financial plans/concepts
Build effective working relationships across various departmental and business line contacts by actively collaborating and sharing knowledge and experience


 DO YOU HAVE THE SKILLS We would love to work with you if you have:


 Experience in the securities industry
Already duly registered as an Investment Representative (IR) with CIRO
Excellent verbal and written communication
Strong organizational skills
Ability to take initiative, work independently and meet deadlines
Meticulous attention to detail and excellent time management skills
Exceptional client service skills


 WHATS IN IT FOR YOU


 At ScotiaMcLeod we help employees build their futures – where they can be themselves, and win together. With a commitment to diversity and inclusion and a performance-oriented culture that includes coaching, learning, and development – there are endless possibilities. At ScotiaMcLeod– you can make an impact. You help make the futures of our 25 million customers happen. You can find your future here.
The opportunity to join a forward-thinking organization where you are surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers.
An organization committed to making a difference in our communities– for you and our clients.
An inclusive working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity and celebrates success.
Learning and Development – free access to Scotia Academy to upskill and develop your skills

Requisition ID: 187494  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 As a Sr. Business Systems Analyst, you will be the bridge between our business partners and our developer's engineers, responsible for delivering exciting products in the Digital Banking Unit. We are investing heavily in order to become the leader in digital banking space, and we are launching multiple initiatives to do so. You will have a unique chance to help one of the fastest-growing business units to become a leader. You will help scale, enable, and drive online & mobile development excellence as our team continues to deliver innovative solutions to Scotia customers.

 What will you do?



 Collaborating with product owners, stakeholders, and development teams to understand business needs, goals, and requirements.
 Facilitating requirements gathering sessions, workshops, and meetings with stakeholders to elicit, analyze, and prioritize requirements.
 Providing estimates for incoming projects at both high level and detailed level requirements for small to medium-sized projects.
 Creating and maintaining product backlogs, user stories, and acceptance criteria using agile techniques and tools.
 Refining and prioritizing product backlog items based on feedback, business value, and technical feasibility.
 Providing guidance and support to development teams during sprint planning, grooming, and review sessions.
 Analyzing and documenting complex business processes and system flows to identify gaps, redundancies, and opportunities for optimization.
 Collaborating with UX designers, architects, and developers to design and implement solutions that meet business needs and align with technical standards and guidelines.
 Conducting testing and validation of software features and functionalities to ensure they meet business requirements and are free of defects.
 Facilitating problem-solving discussions and general communications between the business and IT and within IT itself.
 Ensuring consistent and accurate translation of requirements through all SDLC phases.
 Helping improve and drive engineering practices by providing valuable inputs and suggestions on what works well and what can be done better.
 Communicating project progress, risks, and issues to stakeholders and management to ensure timely and effective decision-making.
 Contributing to a collaborative team environment by information sharing and team cooperation.
 Demonstrating strong personal values and a commitment to our mission and customers.


 What do you need to succeed?



 You have 4+ years of experience involving in progressively more challenging responsibilities as a Business Systems Analyst in IT system solution development. You are also an agile and lean evangelist.
 Ideally, you have an Engineering or Computer Science degree, and pride yourself on analysis, logical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
 You notice all the little details for every document/ requirement/conversation that comes across you, and it drives you crazy that others cannot keep everything consistent.
 You do good work, and lots of it …the drive to deliver quality work is just a part of you. You are also able to simplify complex situations and navigate ambiguity.
 You are great at making sure everyone's speaking the same language and are on the same page, and sometimes that involves some give and take.
 You are able to multi-task and work on multiple initiatives at the same time.
 You stay current on the tools and approaches that work best. And you are excited about working on new projects because every project is a new learning opportunity!
 You enjoy collaborating with, learning from, and teaching others so we all become better.
 Must be bilingual / fluent in English and Spanish


 What's in it for you?



 We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity and curiosity and celebrates success
 We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create meaningful customer experiences
 You’ll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
 We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation.

Job Description:

 About the role


 Our Senior Customer Experience Associates are the face, character and heart of our branches. Scotiabank is a place where we put our customers first, and our priority is to help them achieve their financial goals.  We are looking for an enthusiastic, driven individual who enjoys meaningful conversation and supporting others. As an essential member of the Canadian Banking Branch network, the focus is to provide exceptional service throughout the customer’s journey by:

 Acting as a lobby leader; ensuring customers are appropriately triaged and/or assisted
 Contributing to the Branch’s targets by identifying and fulfilling simple sales opportunities, including opening day-to-day accounts, fulfilling pre-approved credit opportunities, and processing GICs
 Nurturing rich, long-standing relationships
 Being a technology expert and sharing your knowledge by introducing clients to our mobile banking applications and assisting them to better manage their banking needs

 Is this role right for you? In this role you will:

 Build strong customer relationships and deliver excellent customer service
 Uncover and solve customers’ needs
 Explain complicated concepts simply
 Demonstrate success in a target-based performance environment, as well as contribute positively to a team-oriented work environment
 Demonstrate an eagerness to learn and determination to succeed

 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We’d love to work with you if you:

 Have strong customer service skills
 Are willing to assist in a professional, friendly and efficient manner
 Are available to work a flexible schedule

 BRIEF INTRODUCTION

IS THIS ROLE RIGHT FOR YOU In the role you will:


 Ensure effective client administration by managing all administrative processes and escalations requiring investigation
Consistently demonstrate high levels of client service by:
 o supporting the advisor in regular reviews of portfolios including entering client trades as directed by the client or Advisor and identifying client needs
   o responding to client inquiries, resolving issues and effecting client transactions in a timely and responsive manner
  

Provide marketing assistance by coordinating materials, events, and seminars to increase/identify opportunities to grow assets and/or revenue
Support the growth of the business by managing tracking reports for Wealth Advisors to review targets, recommendations, and financial plans/concepts
Build effective working relationships across various departmental and business line contacts by actively collaborating and sharing knowledge and experience

 Experience in the securities industry
Already duly registered as an Investment Representative (IR) with CIRO
Excellent verbal and written communication
Strong organizational skills
Ability to take initiative, work independently and meet deadlines
Meticulous attention to detail and excellent time management skills
Exceptional client service skills

Position: Senior Analyst, Product Management and Development
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 189148  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 About the role
 What your role will be…
 Products Management & Support Consultant

 At Scotiabank we help employees build their futures – where they can be themselves, and win together. With a commitment to diversity and inclusion and a performance-oriented culture that includes coaching, learning, and development – there are endless possibilities. At Scotiabank – you can make an impact. You help make the futures of our 25 million customers happen. You can find your future here.

 What you’ll be doing..
 The Product Management & Support Consultant contributes to the overall success of Scotia Global Asset Management's Product Development and Innovation team, by ensuring specific individual goals, plans, and initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the broader business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing Canadian regulations, internal policies and procedures by:

 Supports and guides key recommendations throughout the ScotiaFunds product lifecycle by conducting research and analysis (e.g., product gap analysis, MER analysis, monitoring sales flow, asset growth, industry trends and developments)
 Acts as a key member of the product initiative implementation workforce, working with partners across the business to deliver tailored product and service solutions through multiple channels, such as Scotiabank branch advisors and mobile advice team, Scotia Wealth Management (ScotiaMcLeod and Private Investment Counsel). 
Assist in creation of advisor/investor support materials and tools, collaborating with Product Marketing and Communication teams.
 Responsible for managing the external data provider relationships, such as Morningstar, by providing information on new products and/or any changes to existing products.
 Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
 Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of their respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.

 
What you need to succeed..

 Undergraduate degree
 3+ years of mutual fund industry experience
 Advanced Microsoft Excel/spreadsheet skills
 Verbal and written communication skills 
Completion of Canadian Securities Course (CSC) and/or level one of the CFA Program 
Experience with Morningstar Direct is an asset


 What we’re offering…

 The opportunity to join a forward-thinking organization where you are surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers.
 A competitive compensation and benefits package.
 An organization committed to making a difference in our communities– for you and our customers.
 You can expect to be recognized and rewarded for high-performance. You’ll be supported by leadership through meaningful development conversations that enable faster advancement and internal training to support your growth and development.
 You’ll receive clear, transparent criteria to progress in your career.

Requisition ID: 189016  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 The Team

 Global Banking and Markets Engineering (GBME) is the fast-moving, award-winning technology engine that powers Scotiabank’s Corporate, Investment Banking, and Capital Markets businesses.

 The Role

 GBME’s Project Excellence Team is searching for a Technical Analyst Advisory to liaison between business stakeholders and internal engineering and architect teams, ensuring solutions are developed and delivered on time, efficiently and with high quality for various projects within GBME.

 The successful candidate will have a results-oriented and curious mindset with strong technical skills. You will work closely with cross functional teams, including engineers, solutions architects, and business teams to develop and implement market leading solutions that are scalable and deliver excellence, and value to our business partners and customers.

 As part of the role, you’ll



 Demonstrate an informed knowledge of business functions to resolve problems and capitalize on improvement opportunities.
 Ensure business specifications/requirements documentation is accurately prepared and comprehensive to support sizing/development efforts and as input to various project documentation.
 Develop and deliver Business Requirements Documents, Design Documents, Use Cases, and Process Models as required.
 Build out new features for applications, utilizing various functional testing frameworks and methodologies.
 Create and execute test cases, utilizing Behavioural Driven Testing Methodologies and Test Driven Methodologies.
 Use critical thinking to work through complex workflows, improving testing logic.
 Participate in the development of detailed project plans, the monitoring of progress against planned objectives, the financial review, and securing consensus and co-operation from users and senior management.
 Work closely across GBME technology teams during all stages of the system development life cycle and bridge the gap between business and technology sides of the solution.
 Liaising between the business community and the IT organization to provide technical solutions that meet user needs.
 Build relationships and communicate effectively with colleagues in Global regions.
 Support production issues and handle escalations during Release cycles as needed.
 Perform ad hoc project work on various GBME projects.


 Minimum Qualifications



 Proven ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications and deliver working results.
 Minimum 2 years’ working knowledge of databases such as PostgrSQL, with ability to create and run queries independently.
 Minimum 2 years’ experience creating automated test cases with Selenium, Cucumber, and other API Frameworks (Karate preferred).
 Thorough understanding of GUI processes, such as how developers utilize network tabs to understand GUI applications.
 Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
 A recognized undergraduate degree or diploma in business administration, computer science or related field required.
 Excellent working experience of Microsoft suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project).


 What's in it for you?



 Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans.
 Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences everyone brings to the Bank and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove, and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.
 Remote-friendly work environment will provide you with the flexibility to perform at your best.
 Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance.
 Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one.
 Community Engagement - no matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons, contests, cooking with friends, Humans of Digital and much more!

 Lead development activities as the senior member of the scrum team, planning and executing to meet sprint objectives as well as program/project milestones
 Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices
 Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs
 Create and maintain software documentation
 Collaborate with the Scrum team to plan milestones, successfully execute software delivery, and escalate issues as needed
 Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
 Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
 Champions a high performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.


 What do you need to succeed?



 In depth knowledge of programming languages, frameworks, utilities, and other technologies used by the team, e.g. NodeJS, React
 Excellent communication skills with ability to influence decision making across stakeholders
 Demonstrated ability to lead team members with differing opinions and levels of experience
 Project management skills to map and execute short and long term plans for the team
 Effective organization, planning, and time management skills

 What's in it for you?



 We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity and curiosity and celebrates success
 We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create meaningful customer experiences
 You’ll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
 We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation.
