Requisition ID: 186742  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Purpose
 The individual will be responsible for setting the Private Banking sales strategy across the IPB footprint. The will lead and achieve strategic business objectives to attract, acquire & grow IPB’s business across Teams in the Pacific Alliance markets (Mexico, Peru, Colombia and Chile), CCAU (Cayman, Bahamas, Jamaica, Panama and Costa Rica) and offshore (Toronto) to grow the IPB business across clients’ onshore and offshore needs – meeting and exceeding sales targets & growth. Acting as an ambassador to internal partners promoting IPB as the leader in private banking relationships, expanding our brand recognition and market awareness.

 A natural relationship builder, the incumbent will invest in developing and maintaining internal & external networks that reliably and effectively support the growth of the business. Through the proactive oversight of sales teams, the incumbent will drive the development of a detailed prospecting plans with senior leadership to achieve volume (deposit, investments, and loans), and new business objectives while optimizing profitability of new and existing relationships, delivering breakout and long-term sustained growth.


 Sets the sale strategy and identify sales goals for Private Banking teams across the IWM footprint
Oversees the development of commercial disciplines for wealth managers to build profitable books of business
Oversees strategies around development of prospects, contacts, and new customers and business partners to increase revenues market share in key markets
Builds a strong sales management process for wealth managers across geographies to increase productivity and meet their goals consistently.
Identifies business development relationships and leads partnership projects such as Wealth / ICCB initiative
Develops analytical and quantitatively driven techniques and approaches to measure the performance of the IPB business across geographies, as well as improve sales management strategies, in order to increase Wealth Managers productivity.
Leads, with the support of Private Banking teams in countries, performance tracking of the IPB business. Develops methodologies to measure revenues, volumes, new clients, and client satisfaction at the level of countries, Private Banking Centers, and individual wealth managers.
Develops and implements customer journeys and lifecycle strategies to help identifying opportunities for growing revenue, boosting operating efficiencies, and enforcing compliance throughout the client lifecycle
Leads the implementation of Total Wealth practice among Wealth Managers, ensuring TW approach is at the center of the sales management disciplines to be implemented.
Lead the analysis of client strategy effectiveness and leverages analytics to manage and optimize campaigns
Design an adequate training for wealth managers across IWM footprint to ensure implementation of a standard sales pitch, enhancement of their selling and persuasion skills, and generation of lead tactics



 Client centric focus


Manage sales leaders and teams to be accountable to deliver exceptional client experiences at every interaction and execute on plans to continuously build the client experience, in line with Scotiabank Wealth Management’s brand promise.
Build expert knowledge of major clients and prospects, market, competition, and economic factors, while having robust understanding of key business issues and trends.
Demonstrate and apply deep market knowledge and external relationships within the private banking space, to support business development goals and the acquisition of new business.
Engage with Marketing and Relationship Management teams with reviewing client/partner satisfaction results and implementing a course of action to improve ratings and grow in the marketplace.




 Accountabilities


Leads and drives a performance driven and client centric culture throughout the Sales Development Teams in the Pacific Alliance markets (Mexico, Peru, Colombia and Chile), CCAU (Cayman, Bahamas, Jamaica, Panama and Costa Rica) and offshore (Toronto) to grow the IPB business across clients’ onshore and offshore needs.




 P & L Management


Contributes to the multi-year business growth of IPB (through the annual planning cycle), sales, client growth and retention goals for the unit.
Develop multi-year plan for the profitable growth of the IPB client base based on client segmentation data, market/economic conditions, IWM objectives and competitive positioning, and translate these into meaningful and actionable objectives for IPB business units in the countries.
Helps design a results-based reward and recognition strategies and programs, motivate staff to achieve their personal objectives and contribute to their colleagues’ objectives, in all areas of the business.




 Sales and Strategy Support


Orchestration of appropriate and robust sales development objectives, developing business plans, regular assessments against minimum targets and standards, performance appraisals against existing targets.
Work closely with and developing strong relationships with all relevant partners, including International Investment Advisory (IIA), Jarislowsky Fraser (JF), International Wealth Structuring (IWS) and International Corporate and Commercial Banking (ICCB), Affluent team (IB Retail) and IB Marketing.
Continually analyze new market trends, develop thorough understanding of the needs of private banking clientele, the competition, and regulatory and compliance environments and changes.



 Sales Management

   Develop and implement a new Sales Management strategy and framework across IPB; build scalable solutions and capabilities that will position in-field teams and leaders to deliver more
   Total Wealth, improved business growth and productivity while ensuring an enhanced client and Wealth Manager experience
  

Be accountable for translating business strategies and priorities into executable tools, activities, and practices, ensuring knowledge and adoption of initiatives are well understood Wealth Managers to maximize benefits, minimize risks and drive steady Net Promoter Score (NPS) increases
Support sales teams across IPB markets in enhancing their understanding of Private Banking servicing offering, value propositions and pricing models.
Design and develop sales management capability tools and enablers to increase and sustain sales performance and embed and sustain strategies and initiatives.




 Talent Management


Creates an environment in which his/her team maintains effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.
Builds a high-performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops, and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment, communicating vison/values/business strategy, and managing succession and development planning for the team.




 Leadership and Governance


Ensures superior quality client service, ensure a smooth and efficient operational routine is in place, and ensure that daily and periodic management controls are effective.
Performs reviews of all new business; including deposit and lending providing authorization as required.
Adheres to Bank and Branch security procedures with respect to assigned authorities and responsibilities. Review client complaints to determine what, if any, compliance issues/trends are in evidence.
Familiar with Know Your Customer (KYC) and AML/ATF policies
Ensures familiarity with all relevant AML/ATF Regulations which impact the business.
Reviewing customer transactions and activity according to established policies and procedures through the daily review of the AML Reports
Submitting required AML/ATF reports such as Unusual Transaction Reports (UTRs)
Assisting in obtaining additional information from customers on SARs, UTRs, KYC, etc, as required
Ensuring that training on AML/ATF matters is provided within established policies and procedures
Participate in other assignments as required.


 IWM Strategy and adoption

Participate and contribute with IWM Management to drive multiyear strategy adoption for Scotiabank’s offshore client offering
Contribute to development and management of incentive frameworks (compensation, recognition, and total rewards)
Actively manage a thorough understanding of client segments including HNW (entrepreneurs, professionals, multi-generational wealth) and UHNW

 Education / Experience

The incumbent must have an excellent knowledge of all Private Banking and Wealth Management products and services as well as a though understanding of commercial and retail credit principles.
In-depth knowledge in sales and service design concepts and management techniques
Strong understanding of the PB markets business and political environment in IWM footprint
Proven leader of large teams in a dynamic, complex, customer-oriented environment
A sophisticated/strategic sales approach which is solution based and that leverages the strength and capabilities of the organization
Strong organization & self-management skills to convert strategic objectives and plans into measurable results
Exceptional presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills
Ability to keep up to date on past, current, and future trends in the financial services industry
Pro-active, self-starter with the ability to use exemplary leadership skills to maximize sales
Superior leadership: demonstrated ability to lead, manage, coach, and motivate a team of highly independent and effective professionals with a proven talent for optimizing team synergies and divisional collaborations
Leadership, executing on business plan, team building and strategic influencing skills and the ability to work in a cross-functional, matrixed work environment.
Fluency (oral and written) in English and Spanish
Possess proficiency with MS Office (particularly Excel and PowerPoint), Salesforce, Power BI
MBA or degree in business or equivalent

Position: Gestionnaire, Risque du Crédit Petites Entreprises
Job Description:
Numéro de la demande: 188462  Joignez une équipe gagnante, engagée et axée sur les résultats qui évolue dans une culture inclusive et de haut rendement.


 But
 Le gestionnaire de risque du crédit des petites entreprises, est chargé d'exercer un jugement en matière de crédit avancé et de fournir des décisions de qualité pour les demandes de crédit des petites entreprises. Le titulaire doit se conformer à la politique de la Banque et aux autorisations d'exception établies, tout en équilibrant les objectifs de production.
  

Les Responsabilités


Appliquer un jugement de crédit avancé, en utilisant les 5 C de crédit applicables.
Analyser efficacement les demandes de crédit des partenaires, avec la documentation, tout en respectant l'appétit pour le risque et la culture de la Banque dans les activités et les décisions quotidiennes.
Démontrer une connaissance des risques généraux liés à l'industrie et pertinents dans l'ensemble de l'économie canadienne.
Fournir des décisions de crédit qui communiquent clairement les termes et conditions de l'adjudication.
Assurer que la documentation et la rationnelle de risque appropriée sont appuyer sur le dossier pour supporter la décision de crédit.
Agir avec un sentiment d'urgence en réponse aux demandes des partenaires pour répondre aux attentes des clients.
Fournir des recommandations/solutions alternatives et restructurer les demandes de crédit, avec coaching/direction aux partenaires au besoin.
Travailler efficacement dans un environnement en évolution rapide pour contribuer à la réalisation de l'accord de niveau de service établi par le CEA.
Atteindre régulièrement l’objectif de KPI tel qu'établi et contribuer à « Du Premier Coup »
Contribuer au soutien des transaction « Deal Support » (centre de contact interne au CEA) pour fournir des conseils sur les demandes des crédits parvenant des banquiers.
Contribuer aux activités de gestion Lean, y compris les séances de résolution de problèmes, le coaching et les caucus.
Identifier et escalader tous les problèmes identifiés (par exemple, lutte contre le blanchiment d'argent - AML; Protection de la vie privée; Connaissez votre client-KYC; Conformité)
Respecter les valeurs de la Banque Scotia, son code de conduite et les principes de vente mondiaux.
Participation active au développement personnel et à l'apprentissage, tout en promouvant un environnement de travail positif et inclusif.
Entraînement et mentorat des collègues au besoin.



 Compétence / Études / Expérience / Autres informations


Une connaissance approfondie des produits/services aux petites entreprises de la Banque et des politiques et procédures de prêt.
Analyse intermédiaire des états financiers et comptabilité général.
Bonne compréhension de l'évaluation des risques, des structures/protections de crédit, de la documentation de crédit, des projections financières et des rapports de crédit d'Equifax/TransUnion
Compétences fortes en analyse et en résolution de problèmes
Connaissance de tous les systèmes pertinents applicables à l'unité ACE, aux systèmes interactifs de la Banque et aux outils Microsoft (Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, OneNote).
Connaissance approfondie des exigences réglementaires et de conformité de la Banque en ce qui a trait à l'octroi de crédits, y compris la protection de la vie privée, la lutte contre le blanchiment d'argent (LBC), le financement des activités terroristes ; et les exigences de connaissance du client (KYC)
Solide esprit d'équipe et habile à développer des relations harmonieuses avec les membres de l'équipe de l'unité et tous nos partenaires.
Une communication efficace (bilingue anglais/français - écrit et verbal) et des compétences interpersonnelles sont nécessaires pour une interaction professionnelle avec nos partenaires d’affaires afin d'assurer un haut niveau de crédibilité.
Doit être organisé et être un décideur efficace pour répondre aux exigences d'un environnement à volume élevé
Une expérience de travail en analyse de crédit et de travail dans un environnement Lean est un atout.
Études postsecondaires requises. Les diplômes en finance/comptabilité/économie sont un atout.



 Emplacement(s): Canada : Ontario : Mississauga || Canada : Québec : Montreal  La Banque Scotia compte parmi les chefs de file du secteur bancaire au Canada et des fournisseurs de services financiers dans les Amériques. Nous sommes là pour l’avenir de tous. Nous contribuons à la réussite de nos clients, de leur famille et de leur collectivité en offrant des conseils et une vaste gamme de produits et de services, dont des services bancaires aux particuliers, aux entreprises et aux sociétés, des services bancaires privés, d’investissement et de gestion de patrimoine ainsi que des services liés aux marchés des capitaux.  Nous valorisons les compétences et les expériences uniques que chacun apporte à la Banque et nous nous engageons à offrir un environnement inclusif et accessible pour tous. Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation durant le processus de recrutement et de sélection (p. ex. un lieu d’entrevue accessible, des documents dans un autre format, un interprète de la langue des signes ou une technologie d’assistance), veuillez en informer notre équipe de recrutement. Pour obtenir du soutien technique, cliquez ici. Les candidats doivent postuler directement en ligne. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt pour la Banque Scotia; cependant, nous communiquerons uniquement avec les personnes retenues pour une entrevue.

Position: Financial Planner, Investment Specialist, Smiths Falls ON
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 189284  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 As a Financial Planner (Investment Specialist), you will focus on developing and deepening client relationships by providing high quality advice and service within the mass affluent market. As a dedicated entrepreneur, you understand that growing a practice is all about building long-term relationships. You know how to leverage your external networks and centers of influence and welcome the freedom to grow your own practice. Most importantly, you realize that your clients are your greatest asset, and your priority is providing investment and financial planning advice to help them meet their unique goals.

 You also excel at building new relationships and enjoy the flexibility of being able to meet clients outside of the office, on a schedule that best suits you and your clients. Finally, you recognize the value of working within a collective Scotiabank framework that benefits both your clients and your practice overall.

 Following a comprehensive financial planning framework, you will be responsible for driving investment sales and new client acquisition, while adhering to Global Sales Principles, compliance and regulatory requirements as well as establishing business development opportunities with prospects and clients within the assigned market area.

 Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:
 
Promote the development and sustainable growth of proprietary investment business in the assigned market area by:

 Business Development: Executing on business development plans for prospects and existing clients within the mass affluent market. Identifying additional investment business development opportunities and facilitating the implementation of an investment solution and/or referral to the appropriate partners.
 Client-Centric: Providing client-centric investment solutions through a financial planning framework, aligning with Global Sales Principles. Conducting outbound communications and proactive calling to prospects to remain top-of-mind for future business opportunities. Conducting complimentary needs analysis across several financial statements, including competitor statements.
 Community Involvement: Participating actively in local professional and community events and associations to develop and expand your network. Identifying opportunities to deliver community information sessions and financial seminars to grow prospects. Building and maintaining a market profile in the assigned market area. Networking with investment industry specialists while managing a small budget for independent marketing-based activities.

 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We’d love to work with you if you have:
 

3 years of experience in financial planning and investment sales.
 You’re a mutual funds certified professional. You have current accreditation and good standing for MFDA licensing requirements (Investments Funds in Canada or Canadian Securities Course). 
You are actively working towards a Financial Planning designation. You have completed the education requirements towards a Personal Financial Planning (PFP®) designation and/or a Certified Financial Planner (CFP®) designation.
 Proven networking, client acquisition and interpersonal skills; experience building and maintaining Centres of Influence (COIs)
 You’re goal oriented and entrepreneurial. You can work independently as a self-motivated entrepreneur with minimal supervision and as part of a larger team.
 Extensive knowledge of competitive offerings, market trends, economic conditions, and the regulatory environment.
 A valid driver's license and access to a vehicle, to meet clients and prospects within the designated district.


 What’s in it for you?

 An entrepreneurial culture with the freedom to develop your career.
 A fast-paced, flexible work environment where you can set your own hours and meet clients when and where it’s convenient for them.
 A compensation structure that rewards growing and maintaining your client base.
 Access to leading-edge resources to support your growth including dedicated marketing support, powerful mobile technology, leading CRM, portfolio, and financial planning software.
 The ability to build long-lasting client relationships through exceptional advice and service.
 Ability to provide an excellent client experience without going to the branch.
 A partnership with our branches and access to Scotia Global Asset Management to deliver an exceptional client experience.
 A work culture that promotes diversity, respect, and inclusion.


 Other Information
 Please note that the compensation structure for this role is base plus variable pay. This is a mobile role and will require frequent travel.

Requisition ID: 189279  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Purpose The Senior Manager, Small Business Recoveries is primarily responsible for leading a team of 6 Senior Litigation Officers to maximize the net recovery of a portfolio of non-performing Small Business Loans while protecting the bank against reputational risk. The incumbent has the responsibility of determining recovery strategy in consultation with Senior Litigation Officers and external partners to maximize recoveries, while looking after the best overall interests of the customer and the Bank. The Senior Manager is responsible to monitor performance and coach the Senior Litigation Officers to affect the best recovery activities while also monitoring the performance of external partners and allocating work appropriately to ensure the best results for the bank. The incumbent is also responsible for managing relationships with key internal and external business partners and should be prepared to provide updates to senior leadership (as required) as to the performance of the team and portfolio.

 Accountabilities
 1. Provide quality decisions to minimize losses and improve profitability on accounts assigned to Small Business Collections by:
  

Effectively analyzing problems and providing ongoing observational and situational coaching to develop the skills and potential of the team.
Assessing potential assignments to Recovery and rerouting or assigning as needed.
Collaborating with Senior Litigation Officers and external partners to determine the appropriate recovery strategy and ensuring it is undertaken.
Approving external costs or escalating in accordance with authority limits
Preparing or directing the preparation of credit authorizations and exercising sound credit judgement based on thorough investigations and analysis.
Granting, renewing, declining or restructuring credit requests within specified lending limits and making recommendations to higher authorities for loans over these limits.
Keeping abreast of changes in accounting practices, government and tax regulations, and other factors as they relate to financial statement presentation.



 2. Provide customer service meeting Bank standards and retain and increase the overall profitability of assigned customer relationships by:
  

Providing guidance and counsel to SBC customers through consistent and proactive communication.
Ensuring consistent application of service standards, risk policies and related processes
Participating in regional and district sales meetings and conferences to communicate to our internal customers to better understand their needs
Ensuring internal/external customers’ concerns/issues are dealt with in a timely and consistent manner with efforts made to meet the best interests of the Bank and the customer.



 3. Leading a team of Senior Litigation Officers by:
  

Leading my example
Effectively communicating and implementing changes.
Timely escalation of issues to the higher authorities and/or applicable Shared Services department as appropriate with recommendations/solutions.
Ensuring the Team complies with all applicable legal and regulatory requirements
Investigating and escalating with recommendations any opportunities to improve operational effectiveness
Monitoring recovery activity and overall team performance through periodic reviews of team members’ portfolios to ensure performance standards i.e. recoveries, volume/productivity, service standards appropriateness of action plans for resolution of individual accounts and portfolio management are maintained.



 4. Develop and maintain sound banking management practices by:
  

Providing guidance and counsel on corrective action to line management in Branches, Global Risk Management: ACE, CRU, CCC, Security and Investigation, and Private Banking for accounts assigned or others, as requested.

 5. Perform other sundry duties as assigned.
 

 Education / Experience / Other Information


Expert problem solving, conflict resolution/management, mediation, and negotiation skills, to restructure credits and implement pricing increases and fees under adverse conditions.
Team focus – working effectively with others to achieve common objectives
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) to communicate effectively with internal and external customers, and other partners including ACE, CRU, Canadian Banking, Office of the President, Industry groups etc.
Team leadership - Setting and championing a clear future direction and demonstrating actions expected in others including a high standard of performance
Coaching – providing guidance, support and feedback to others to improve their performance. Clarifying job functions and responsibilities. Fostering on an individual basis, the learning and development of others. Exhibit a genuine intent to develop others
Solid knowledge of all issues pertaining to regulatory compliance i.e. Privacy Code, Basel, SOX, Bank Act, AML/KYC
Thorough understanding of banking and an expert knowledge of the Bank’s Small Business Lending Policies and Procedures
Thorough understanding of the legal process relating to commercial and civil actions.
Expert understanding of security documentation, legal ramifications, and remedies
Expert understanding of the guidelines relating to Small Business lending under the HASCAP, CEBA, CSBFA program and other federal, provincial and regional programs.
Thorough understanding of financial statements and interpretation
Thorough understanding of the Bankruptcy Act
Thorough knowledge of Branch systems eg. CIS, Bolds, Intralink, TCS, CACS, PLMS, Scotiaworx, CACS
Working knowledge of Branch and CAU routines and operating procedures
Working knowledge of Shared Services processes
Proven leadership and ability to set direction and maintain focus of team
Proven knowledge of Business legal structures and insolvency law as it applies to small business
Proven understanding of capital structure as it relates to secured and unsecured obligations, third party support / agreements and legal remedies
Proven communication skills (written and verbal) to communicate effectively with internal partners, external legal partners and trustees
Thorough knowledge of collection systems used including Litigation Highway, Bankruptcy Highway, Collection Highway, Intralink, PLMS and CACS
Thorough knowledge knowledge of the functions of a computer terminal.

Position: Financial Advisor, Investment & Retirement Planning- Southdale & Colonel Talbot
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 187728  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.




 About the role


 As a Financial Advisor, Investment & Retirement Planning you are a member of the branch sales team responsible for contributing to the team’s overall success by meeting/exceeding negotiated deposit and investment sales goals through effective management of your assigned portfolio of customers. Your primary role is to establish/deepen investment and primary banking relationships with existing assigned customers as well as customers referred by branch partners.
 Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

 Be passionate about financial sales as well as delivering trusted financial advice to customers regarding complex investment and retirement planning to customers

 Successfully completed the CIFP Diploma in Financial Planning (or Bank recognized equivalent)

 Ability to cultivate strong relationships with customers, peers and partners

 A competitive compensation and benefits package tailored for the Financial Advisor, Retirement and Investment Planning role

 An organization committed to making a difference in our communities – for you and your customers

Position: Senior Manager, Partnerships and Corporate Sponsorships - 13-Month Contract
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 189219  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Purpose
 Leads and oversees MD Financials’ corporate sponsorship strategy and philanthropic initiatives in Canada, as well as all representative group partnerships. This role is responsible for identifying opportunities, as well as developing and executing strategies, plans and initiatives within the identified programs to support corporate business objectives, ensuring they are executed / delivered in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures. The incumbent will also work closely with senior executives and leaders internally and externally to provide sponsorship advice related to funded requests through the BNS-MD-CMA Affinity agreement.

 Accountabilities

 1. Leads the MD Corporate Sponsorship Program and Philanthropic initiatives by:



 Having full accountability and ownership of all program aspects including development, strategy, relationship management, contracts, execution, budget, and results
 Identifying business development opportunities within the medical community that enable MD to expand its reach and drive acquisition
 Overseeing the management of MD’s sponsorship intake software and the team that reviews assessment and execution of all sponsorship requests for MD including contract development, legal approvals, and strategies for contract execution (marketing, communications, logistics, budget, metrics, and evaluation)
 Is the primary point of contact with the BNS philanthropy team, overseeing the collaboration on all philanthropic and sponsorship requests between MD-BNS to ensure impactful investments and unnecessary duplication
 Ensuring the necessary governance models, systems, policies, and procedures are in place to ensure business excellence as well as to staff adherence to brand standards, and legal and regulatory requirements
 Providing expertise and guidance to Regional Heads and other business lines to guide decision making of regional sponsorship programs
 Leading the development of external facing Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion strategy as it relates to the corporate sponsorship program at MD
 Oversees the adherence of co-branded (MD-BNS) brand guidelines through the development and implementation of processes and policies within the sponsorship programs at MD and BNS


 2. Provides advice to the Sponsorship workstream for the BNS-MD-CMA Affinity program by:



 Being a subject matter expert, providing advice or recommendations to the BNS-MD-CMA Affinity Advisory Committee on program funding and strategy in relation to Representative Groups, Sponsorship and Philanthropy
 Ensuring collaboration between various stakeholders and process is followed re: intake, evaluation, and execution) for Sponsorship funding from the Affinity program including collaboration with MD, CMA and BNS marketing, communications, and philanthropy teams. For example, if a sponsorship request is received by MD but is for Affinity – ensure it is triaged to Affinity (Intake). This role may be consulted for their expert views re: sponsorship requests made to Affinity (Evaluation). The role may be approached to help promote a sponsorship. E.g. Affinity is sponsoring an event. It would be valued to invite members of a representative group – invite to come from representative group relationship owner (Execution)
 Consulting and liaising with external organizations if representative group partner of MD and BNS to refine and revise abstract submissions in preparation for advisory committee review


 3. Leads the relationship management of all representative group partnerships by:



 Evolving partnerships and enhancing value for BNS and MD. Acquiring new partnerships or renewing/renegotiating agreements as aligned with the Partnerships and Alliance strategy
 Is the lead relationship manager and fosters relationships with representative groups (groups other that PTMAS and clinical), to drive acquisition, enhance brand awareness, improve reputation, and obtain key insights into the medical community on behalf of MD and BNS
 Directing team member coordination and execution of partnership deliverables, guiding strategy and supporting execution as required. Includes oversight on all aspects of partner management, integration with internal stakeholders, and reporting
 Regularly conducts and leads meetings with partners and clients, often engaging and/or representing various internal business units with their partner requests
 Leverages reporting, analytics, and partner audits to contribute to an ongoing assessment, optimization and creation of new acquisition, engagement, and retention programs within the partnerships

 4. Contributes to the development and execution of strategies to achieve the Partnership and Alliances’ business objectives by:



 Supporting the head of Partnerships and Alliances in the overall planning and execution of the P&A team, including the development of the annual functional plans
 Developing the plan in collaboration with internal and external partners, outlining objectives, key messages, strategies, tactics, and measures, effectively leveraging all appropriate channels
 Attending partnership, sponsorship, and affinity funded events to enhance strategic relationships and ensure brand message and client experience are delivered appropriately strengthening and building awareness across the enterprise
 Tracking, analyzing, and reporting on activities and results with a focus on ROI
 Developing and managing budgets
 Ensuring all legal, tax and regulatory requirements are met
 Leading and driving a customer focused culture throughout their team to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.
 Understanding how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
 Creating an environment in which their team pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
 Building a high performance environment and implementing a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops, and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment and using a coaching mindset and behaviours; communicating vison/values/business strategy; and, managing succession and development planning for the team.


 Dimensions



 Oversees a team of 2 FTE
 Capable of engaging and working directly with senior leaders across the organizations (BNS,MD, CMA) as well as external leaders within the various P&A partnerships, and be able to win their trust and build strong professional relationships
 Accountabilities for all representative group partnership contracts (10+ contracts at ~$450M), the MD Corporate Sponsorship Program (~40 sponsorships/year in Canada), and elements of and guidance to the BNS-MD-CMA Affinity Agreement’s Sponsorship workstream programs (~ $3MM/year in programming)
 Accountable for the MD sponsorship intake and project management software system for MD Nationally
 The role is expected to direct the resolution of a wide variety of issues involving various internal and external stakeholders. This requires the person in this role to have extensive leadership and multi-tasking skills along with the ability to manage several initiatives simultaneously.


 Education / Experience / Other Information



 University degree (Commerce, Marketing, Communications)
 Minimum 10 years of relevant experience in business development and partner/sponsor management, including the development and execution of programming with experience in the financial services and wealth management industry.
 Demonstrated expertise in relationship building, corporate development and/or partner relations.
 Knowledge of physicians/medical profession and /or Canadian Health Care environment an asset
 Bilingualism (English/French) is preferred

Requisition ID: 189028  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Job Purpose:
 The Corporate Functions and Expense Management team manages the Bank's expense management policies and processes, including planning, forecasting and reporting, while providing insightful analysis and recommendations for management. The team is also responsible for compensation/benefit planning, accounting, reporting and analysis. The Manager, Compensation & Benefits Finance is responsible for managing the planning and analysis of Centrally Administered Expenses. This includes, but not limited to depreciation, employee pension and benefits, capital taxes, and legal provisions. The individual is also responsible for the consolidation and reporting of all Centrally Administered Expenses. The individual is responsible for plan, forecast, and actual results and is expected to apply analytical thinking skills to drive the accuracy of results, analytics and forecasts and pursue new ideas/processes to further the enhance the timeliness and efficiency of deliverables. The incumbent is also responsible for the appropriate allocations of these expenses to the business lines. This position works with various HR teams, Accounting Policy, Business Line Finance and Taxation.

 Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:
 1.Manage the consolidation, reporting, analysis and forecasting of Centrally Administered Expenses by working with Total Rewards and Finance teams to collect financial data and analyze and present results, including commentaries to the Senior Manager, Director and VP. Perform reasonability, analysis of month-end results and identify and resolve gaps and or accounting/booking issues.
 2. Assist the Senior Manager and the team in the month-end accounting close, reconciliation and analysis of centrally managed Pension and Benefits and Share-Based Payment plans 
3. Work with Total Rewards and Finance partners in forecasting and planning centrally administered expense components - depreciation, pension and benefits, employee recognition programs, capital taxes, HST credit and legal provisions. Prepare and present analysis to the Senior Manager, Director and VP. Review and challenge forecast and planning assumptions received from Total Rewards and Finance partners. 
4. Develop and maintain equitable allocation drivers and methodologies under the mandate of this role. Effectively communicate transparency of these drivers to the business lines and address potential issues or feedback as appropriate.
 5. Monitor, track, reconcile and report all expenses recorded and allocated to the Other Segment (EO business line). Prepare monthly analysis and commentaries and present to the Senior Manger, Director and VP. Prepare forecast and plan of all expenses in the Other Segment
 6. Actively support the team and the Senior Manager by providing analytics and commentary for adhoc requests from senior management (including the CFO) and our business and Finance partners.
 7. Proactively work with team and the Senior Manager and Director in pursuing enhancements that will create efficiencies within our processes and add value and additional insight to our customers and business partners.

 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? - We'd love to work with you if you have:

 Ability to develop strong relationships with key stakeholders and work with a cross-functional team
 Desire and ability to challenge existing processes and execute change to better support business partners.
 Ability to manage high volumes of complex information with tight deadlines
 Ability to scrutinize and analyze information and/or data inputs when reviewing financial results and forecasts
 Strong communication skills (both verbal and written)
 Advanced Excel skills (including experience with pivot tables, vlookups, etc.) and ability to design spreadsheets and automate processes
 Strong attention to details
 University degree in finance, accounting, or business. 
Accounting designation and/or graduate degree in finance/accounting/business would be an asset.


 What’s in it for you?

 An inclusive & collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
 We offer a competitive rewards package: Performance bonus, Employee Share Ownership Program, and Pension Plan Matching, Health Benefits from day one!
 Your career matters! You will have access to career development and progression opportunities.

 Accountabilities

 testing and monitoring

Experience of working with Enterprise Architecture Frameworks and their application
Cloud infrastructure, Azured SQL datastores
HA Design/Architecture principles


  Working Conditions


 Work in a standard office-based environment; non-standard hours may be required during code releases or production issues. Hybrid working model is in place where all staff is expected to be in person certain days a week. No travel is required

 The Team 
The Payroll Technology team plays a critical role in enabling Global HR Technology to deliver against its mission to meet all operational commitments to IT and HR and driving strategic priorities forward.
 
The Role 
As a Director of Payroll Technology Projects, your role is to lead and provide oversight to critical payroll projects. You will ensure technology is designed, tested, and delivered timely and accurately while ensuring compliance. This is an exciting opportunity to innovate and deliver on critical projects. This role requires a blench of technical proficiency, project management skills and a deep understanding of payroll to drive a successful project.
 
Some of the Key Accountabilities include:

 Provides strategic direction and leadership for the implementation of Canadian payroll technology projects and initiatives.
 Provides leadership and support to a team of payroll technologist in the design and build of new payroll solutions. 
Ensure the quality and accuracy of payroll technology solutions through establishing quality standards and rigorous testing by Scotiabank’s Quality Assurance team. 
Leads a team of IT professionals located in Toronto, Stratford, and Bogotá to deliver the above initiatives. 
Works with third party vendors to develop technical solutions and ensures vendors meet project expectations and contractual agreements. 
Ensure thorough documentation of project processes, decisions, and outcomes.
 Ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards as it relates to payroll and technology.
 Identify potential project and operational risks and develops strategies to mitigate them.


 What You Will Bring to Succeed 

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field. 
Minimum of 10+ years’ work experience in a leadership role in payroll technology or operations. 
Deep understanding of payroll systems and technology 
Minimum of 7+ years experience working with SAP ECC or SuccessFactors Employee Central Payroll through leading technology projects or payroll operations
 Project management experience with agile, waterfall or hybrid project methodologies
 Expert compliance and regulatory knowledge for Canadian payroll. Preference will be given to candidates with NPI certification. 
Understanding of integrating payroll systems with other ERP for seamless data flow and process integration
 Understanding of IT governance frameworks and cybersecurity best practices to ensure security of payroll systems and data.

 
The Workplace 

We are technology partners who help the business transform how our employees around the world work 
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success! 
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world 
We foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning
 We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results 
We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation

Position: Platform Lead, Senior Development Manager for ServiceNow
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 189248  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Purpose

 The Senior Manager and Lab Lead acts as the principal technical and subject matter expert for their assigned category of modules and tools in Scotia Service Now.
 
They lead a team of developers, Business Analysts and Quality Assurance Testers, and partner with their assigned Product Owner(s) to deliver on business requirements in an agile and effective manner. In doing so they assure that all technology delivered is resilient, sustainable, secure and provides an excellent employee experience.
 
Accountabilities
 
As Senior Manager Development , develops and configures solutions on ServiceNow including workflows, integrations, scripts, and UIs in accordance with SMT development and architecture standards.
 

Works closely with the product owner and technical navigator to build backlog, sprint plans and roadmaps.
 Supports the technical navigator to ensure all lab ceremonies are conducted to provide necessary feedback loops.
 Lab tech lead. Providing coaching, guidance, and direction on technical design and solutions
 Conducts vendor oversight in the lab by ensuring lab vets vendor requirements, solution and code against Service Management Technology design principles, Scotiabank Reference Architecture and SMT Coding standards.
 Provides effort estimates, timing recommendations as relates to projects, provides technical leadership for projects in their domain and oversees vendor work.
 Engages with architecture to design great solutions and ensures technical documentation is maintained. 
Coordinates with other labs and their domain lead to ensure dependencies are considered and resolved.
 Coordinates L2/L3 support and support for platform upgrades as relates to their applications/ modules/ components. This includes engaging in and leading any incident management related to their space.
 Develops and maintains deep expertise on their functional area, both in terms of policy (e.g., ITIL) and tooling (ServiceNow certifications). Provides their product owner with insights for useful new features.
 Work to aggressively eliminate technical debt in the Scotia ServiceNow platform, and to build solutions that minimize customization and optimize for speed and optimal user experience.
 Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
 Creates an environment in which their team pursues effective and efficient operations of their respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct, and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk. 
Builds a high-performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops, and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment and using a coaching mindset and behaviours; communicating vison/values/business strategy; and managing succession and development planning for the team.


 Education and experience



 Computer Science Diploma or Degree; or related work experience, excellent JavaScript skills 
ITIL Foundation certification or training. 
ServiceNow Advanced System Administrator certified. ServiceNow Scripting certification a plus.
 3 - 5 years of ServiceNow Experience is a must have within modules/applications (and ServiceNow in general). 
3 plus configuration on the ServiceNow Platform.
 Strong partnership and collaboration skills. 
An interest in leading people, and in developing coaching.

Position: First Nations/Metis/Inuit: Sr. Analyst, Financial Regulatory Reporting, Fully Remote
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 184149  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Posted pursuant to Scotiabank’s Special Measure Program under the Employment Equity Act and Canadian Human Rights Act.

 While you must be an Indigenous person in order to submit your resume, participation is completely voluntary. Please use the definition below to make sure you’re eligible and open to self-identifying as Indigenous person:

 Indigenous Peoples include First Nations, Métis and Inuit people. Only those Indigenous peoples who come from Canada should identify themselves as belonging to this designated group.

 Scotiabank provides extended benefits to Indigenous employees aimed at supporting and promoting their culture.

 Job Purpose
 The Regulatory reporting team manages and oversees financial regulatory reporting for the Bank and assigned subsidiaries. The Senior Analyst prepares and submits a subset of the team’s returns ensuring complete, accurate and timely completion in accordance with instructions provided by regulators as well as established procedures and deadlines.

 Accountabilities Regulatory Reporting Manage the production of assigned regulatory returns at the Bank and/or subsidiary level ensuring completeness, accuracy and timely filing of all financial reports with the Regulators (e.g., OSFI, Bank of Canada, Statistics Canada, CDIC), and keeping abreast of regulatory changes.
 Interpret and implement new reporting requirements and manage the implementation of system and procedural changes to ensure compliance with new regulatory requirements.

 Regulatory Reporting Target Operating Model (RRTOM) related activities Document business requirements for assigned returns, design test cases and monitor UAT for system implementation and participate in various types of testing

 Financial Reporting Manage the production of information for assigned financial statements notes ensuring that procedures and processes reflect the latest requirements and ensure adequate controls exist to validate the accuracy and completeness of the disclosures.

 Accounting and Other Initiatives Participate, as required, in accounting and other initiatives impacting financial regulatory filings, including new or enhanced systems, changes in accounting standards, new products or acquisitions and disposals SOX Compliance/Process Improvements As a SOX process owner for stated responsibilities, ensure strong process controls are implemented and documentation is prepared and updated regularly for Financial and Regulatory processes. On an ongoing basis, ensure processes are reviewed regularly and enhanced where required.

 Change Management: Embrace and drive change as required. Identify opportunities to improve efficiency and propose changes to the management.

 Other projects and initiatives as required. Manage ad- hoc projects as assigned by the management or other areas in the group


 Education / Experience / Skills required


Post-secondary education in a related discipline or equivalent experience is required
Pursuing an accounting designation and/or prior experience working in a regulatory reporting environment will be an asset
Knowledge of IFRS and financial regulatory requirements with strong understanding of financial and management accounting principles
Related working experience and/or knowledge of returns filed to various regulators are an asset (e.g. M4, Z4, other OSFI and Bank of Canada returns)
Good analytical, conceptual and problem-solving skills
Good knowledge of regulatory requirements, with ability to adapt as requirements change
Ability to multitask with conflicting priorities, time and resources
Good time management and organizational skills with the ability to work under tight time constraints
Solid communication and interpersonal skills
Good team building skills, working with diverse groups to resolve issues and identify efficiencies
Ability to develop and leverage strong relationships with key business partners
Strong PC skills with emphasis on Excel, PowerPoint and Word
Sound knowledge of the Bank’s reporting systems such as OBI/EGL/RRS – nice to have
Ability to understand controls in and around systems, ensuring implementation of changes, ongoing maintenance or strengthening of the control environment

Requisition ID: 186742  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Purpose
 The individual will be responsible for setting the Private Banking sales strategy across the IPB footprint. The will lead and achieve strategic business objectives to attract, acquire & grow IPB’s business across Teams in the Pacific Alliance markets (Mexico, Peru, Colombia and Chile), CCAU (Cayman, Bahamas, Jamaica, Panama and Costa Rica) and offshore (Toronto) to grow the IPB business across clients’ onshore and offshore needs – meeting and exceeding sales targets & growth. Acting as an ambassador to internal partners promoting IPB as the leader in private banking relationships, expanding our brand recognition and market awareness.

 A natural relationship builder, the incumbent will invest in developing and maintaining internal & external networks that reliably and effectively support the growth of the business. Through the proactive oversight of sales teams, the incumbent will drive the development of a detailed prospecting plans with senior leadership to achieve volume (deposit, investments, and loans), and new business objectives while optimizing profitability of new and existing relationships, delivering breakout and long-term sustained growth.


 Sets the sale strategy and identify sales goals for Private Banking teams across the IWM footprint
Oversees the development of commercial disciplines for wealth managers to build profitable books of business
Oversees strategies around development of prospects, contacts, and new customers and business partners to increase revenues market share in key markets
Builds a strong sales management process for wealth managers across geographies to increase productivity and meet their goals consistently.
Identifies business development relationships and leads partnership projects such as Wealth / ICCB initiative
Develops analytical and quantitatively driven techniques and approaches to measure the performance of the IPB business across geographies, as well as improve sales management strategies, in order to increase Wealth Managers productivity.
Leads, with the support of Private Banking teams in countries, performance tracking of the IPB business. Develops methodologies to measure revenues, volumes, new clients, and client satisfaction at the level of countries, Private Banking Centers, and individual wealth managers.
Develops and implements customer journeys and lifecycle strategies to help identifying opportunities for growing revenue, boosting operating efficiencies, and enforcing compliance throughout the client lifecycle
Leads the implementation of Total Wealth practice among Wealth Managers, ensuring TW approach is at the center of the sales management disciplines to be implemented.
Lead the analysis of client strategy effectiveness and leverages analytics to manage and optimize campaigns
Design an adequate training for wealth managers across IWM footprint to ensure implementation of a standard sales pitch, enhancement of their selling and persuasion skills, and generation of lead tactics



 Client centric focus


Manage sales leaders and teams to be accountable to deliver exceptional client experiences at every interaction and execute on plans to continuously build the client experience, in line with Scotiabank Wealth Management’s brand promise.
Build expert knowledge of major clients and prospects, market, competition, and economic factors, while having robust understanding of key business issues and trends.
Demonstrate and apply deep market knowledge and external relationships within the private banking space, to support business development goals and the acquisition of new business.
Engage with Marketing and Relationship Management teams with reviewing client/partner satisfaction results and implementing a course of action to improve ratings and grow in the marketplace.




 Accountabilities


Leads and drives a performance driven and client centric culture throughout the Sales Development Teams in the Pacific Alliance markets (Mexico, Peru, Colombia and Chile), CCAU (Cayman, Bahamas, Jamaica, Panama and Costa Rica) and offshore (Toronto) to grow the IPB business across clients’ onshore and offshore needs.




 P & L Management


Contributes to the multi-year business growth of IPB (through the annual planning cycle), sales, client growth and retention goals for the unit.
Develop multi-year plan for the profitable growth of the IPB client base based on client segmentation data, market/economic conditions, IWM objectives and competitive positioning, and translate these into meaningful and actionable objectives for IPB business units in the countries.
Helps design a results-based reward and recognition strategies and programs, motivate staff to achieve their personal objectives and contribute to their colleagues’ objectives, in all areas of the business.




 Sales and Strategy Support


Orchestration of appropriate and robust sales development objectives, developing business plans, regular assessments against minimum targets and standards, performance appraisals against existing targets.
Work closely with and developing strong relationships with all relevant partners, including International Investment Advisory (IIA), Jarislowsky Fraser (JF), International Wealth Structuring (IWS) and International Corporate and Commercial Banking (ICCB), Affluent team (IB Retail) and IB Marketing.
Continually analyze new market trends, develop thorough understanding of the needs of private banking clientele, the competition, and regulatory and compliance environments and changes.



 Sales Management

   Develop and implement a new Sales Management strategy and framework across IPB; build scalable solutions and capabilities that will position in-field teams and leaders to deliver more
   Total Wealth, improved business growth and productivity while ensuring an enhanced client and Wealth Manager experience
  

Be accountable for translating business strategies and priorities into executable tools, activities, and practices, ensuring knowledge and adoption of initiatives are well understood Wealth Managers to maximize benefits, minimize risks and drive steady Net Promoter Score (NPS) increases
Support sales teams across IPB markets in enhancing their understanding of Private Banking servicing offering, value propositions and pricing models.
Design and develop sales management capability tools and enablers to increase and sustain sales performance and embed and sustain strategies and initiatives.




 Talent Management


Creates an environment in which his/her team maintains effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.
Builds a high-performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops, and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment, communicating vison/values/business strategy, and managing succession and development planning for the team.




 Leadership and Governance


Ensures superior quality client service, ensure a smooth and efficient operational routine is in place, and ensure that daily and periodic management controls are effective.
Performs reviews of all new business; including deposit and lending providing authorization as required.
Adheres to Bank and Branch security procedures with respect to assigned authorities and responsibilities. Review client complaints to determine what, if any, compliance issues/trends are in evidence.
Familiar with Know Your Customer (KYC) and AML/ATF policies
Ensures familiarity with all relevant AML/ATF Regulations which impact the business.
Reviewing customer transactions and activity according to established policies and procedures through the daily review of the AML Reports
Submitting required AML/ATF reports such as Unusual Transaction Reports (UTRs)
Assisting in obtaining additional information from customers on SARs, UTRs, KYC, etc, as required
Ensuring that training on AML/ATF matters is provided within established policies and procedures
Participate in other assignments as required.


 IWM Strategy and adoption

Participate and contribute with IWM Management to drive multiyear strategy adoption for Scotiabank’s offshore client offering
Contribute to development and management of incentive frameworks (compensation, recognition, and total rewards)
Actively manage a thorough understanding of client segments including HNW (entrepreneurs, professionals, multi-generational wealth) and UHNW

 Education / Experience

The incumbent must have an excellent knowledge of all Private Banking and Wealth Management products and services as well as a though understanding of commercial and retail credit principles.
In-depth knowledge in sales and service design concepts and management techniques
Strong understanding of the PB markets business and political environment in IWM footprint
Proven leader of large teams in a dynamic, complex, customer-oriented environment
A sophisticated/strategic sales approach which is solution based and that leverages the strength and capabilities of the organization
Strong organization & self-management skills to convert strategic objectives and plans into measurable results
Exceptional presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills
Ability to keep up to date on past, current, and future trends in the financial services industry
Pro-active, self-starter with the ability to use exemplary leadership skills to maximize sales
Superior leadership: demonstrated ability to lead, manage, coach, and motivate a team of highly independent and effective professionals with a proven talent for optimizing team synergies and divisional collaborations
Leadership, executing on business plan, team building and strategic influencing skills and the ability to work in a cross-functional, matrixed work environment.
Fluency (oral and written) in English and Spanish
Possess proficiency with MS Office (particularly Excel and PowerPoint), Salesforce, Power BI
MBA or degree in business or equivalent

Numéro de la demande: 187850  Joignez une équipe gagnante, engagée et axée sur les résultats qui évolue dans une culture inclusive et de haut rendement.




 À propos du role


 Ce que vous ferez Nos conseillers font passer les clients d’abord, et savent établir une vraie relation avec eux. À ce titre, vous faites partie intégrante du Réseau canadien de succursales, et votre principal objectif consiste à offrir un service exceptionnel aux clients tout au long de leur parcours avec nous. Pour ce faire, vous devrez :

 gérer le portefeuille de comptes de propriétaires de petites entreprises à rendement élevé ou de nature complexe qui vous sera attribué afin d’atteindre les objectifs en matière de fidélisation de la clientèle et les autres objectifs négociés tout en respectant les normes de service de la Banque Scotia;
 avoir une grande visibilité dans le milieu des affaires local grâce à l’établissement de relations avec différents centres d’influence;
 aborder des clients nouveaux et actuels afin d’établir des relations soutenues et solides, et leur proposer des conseils éclairés qui favoriseront le succès de leurs affaires;
 collaborer avec les autres conseillers pour créer un environnement centré sur le client.

 Ce que vous avez à offrir

 Votre approche est axée sur les résultats. Vous connaissez bien le marché des petites entreprises, notamment les caractéristiques et les avantages des produits et services proposés à cette clientèle. Vous savez analyser les états financiers, et connaissez les politiques applicables de gestion du risque et les documents relatifs aux aspects juridiques et aux garanties pour les produits destinés aux petites entreprises.
 Vous utilisez d’excellentes techniques de développement des affaires et vous connaissez la structure juridique et le cycle de vie des petites entreprises, l’offre de la concurrence et les autres sources de financement.
 Vous avez le sens de l’organisation et pouvez vous adapter à un environnement qui évolue constamment.
 Vous êtes un bon communicateur et avez de la facilité à établir des relations d’affaires; vous aimez rencontrer les gens et vous collaborez efficacement avec vos collègues.
 Vous avez fait des études dans un domaine lié aux affaires ou possédez une expérience de travail équivalente à titre de propriétaire d’une petite entreprise.
 Vous avez un permis de conduire valide et accès à une automobile fiable.

 Ce que nous offrons

 L’occasion de vous joindre à une institution financière tournée vers l’avenir où vous pourrez travailler avec d’autres secteurs d’activité.
 Un cheminement de carrière enrichissant et diverses possibilités de perfectionnement professionnel.
 Un programme de rémunération concurrentiel et d’excellents avantages sociaux.
 De la formation interne pour vous aider à développer vos connaissances et vos compétences.
 La possibilité de faire partie d’une organisation qui s’est engagée à faire avancer les choses au sein des collectivités, tant pour ses clients que pour ses employés.


 Conformément à l’évaluation des besoins linguistiques effectuée par la Banque Scotia, le candidat retenu doit pouvoir communiquer en anglais et en français car il se peut qu’il serve une clientèle anglophone.




 Emplacement(s): Canada : Québec : Mont-saint-hilaire  La Banque Scotia compte parmi les chefs de file du secteur bancaire au Canada et des fournisseurs de services financiers dans les Amériques. Nous sommes là pour l’avenir de tous. Nous contribuons à la réussite de nos clients, de leur famille et de leur collectivité en offrant des conseils et une vaste gamme de produits et de services, dont des services bancaires aux particuliers, aux entreprises et aux sociétés, des services bancaires privés, d’investissement et de gestion de patrimoine ainsi que des services liés aux marchés des capitaux.  Nous valorisons les compétences et les expériences uniques que chacun apporte à la Banque et nous nous engageons à offrir un environnement inclusif et accessible pour tous. Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation durant le processus de recrutement et de sélection (p. ex. un lieu d’entrevue accessible, des documents dans un autre format, un interprète de la langue des signes ou une technologie d’assistance), veuillez en informer notre équipe de recrutement. Pour obtenir du soutien technique, cliquez ici. Les candidats doivent postuler directement en ligne. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt pour la Banque Scotia; cependant, nous communiquerons uniquement avec les personnes retenues pour une entrevue.

Requisition ID: 189566

 Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
 As an Investment Specialist, you will focus on developing and deepening client relationships by providing high quality advice and service within the mass affluent market. As a dedicated entrepreneur, you understand that growing a practice is all about building long-term relationships. You know how to leverage your external networks and centres of influence and welcome the freedom to grow your own practice. Most importantly, you realize that your clients are your greatest asset, and your priority is providing investment and financial planning advice to help them meet their unique goals.

 You also excel at building new relationships and enjoy the flexibility of being able to meet clients outside of the office, on a schedule that best suits you and your clients. Finally, you recognize the value of working within a collective Scotiabank framework that benefits both your clients and your practice overall.

 Following a comprehensive financial planning framework, you will be responsible for driving investment sales and new client acquisition, while adhering to Global Sales Principles, compliance and regulatory requirements as well as establishing business development opportunities with prospects and clients within the assigned market area.

 Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:
 
Promote the development and sustainable growth of proprietary investment business in the assigned market area by:

 Business Development: Executing on business development plans for prospects and existing clients within the mass affluent market. Identifying additional investment business development opportunities and facilitating the implementation of an investment solution and/or referral to the appropriate partners.



 Client-Centric: Providing client-centric investment solutions through a financial planning framework, aligning with Global Sales Principles. Conducting outbound communications and proactive calling to prospects to remain top-of-mind for future business opportunities. Conducting complimentary needs analysis across several financial statements, including competitor statements.



 Community Involvement: Participating actively in local professional and community events and associations to develop and expand your network. Identifying opportunities to deliver community information sessions and financial seminars to grow prospects. Building and maintaining a market profile in the assigned market area. Networking with investment industry specialists while managing a small budget for independent marketing-based activities.


 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We’d love to work with you if you have:
 

3 years of experience in financial planning and investment sales.



 You’re a mutual funds certified professional. You have current accreditation and good standing for MFDA licensing requirements (Investments Funds in Canada or Canadian Securities Course).



 You are actively working towards a Financial Planning designation. You have completed the education requirements towards a Personal Financial Planning (PFP®) designation and/or a Certified Financial Planner (CFP®) designation.




 Proven networking, client acquisition and interpersonal skills; experience building and maintaining Centres of Influence (COIs)



 You’re goal oriented and entrepreneurial. You can work independently as a self-motivated entrepreneur with minimal supervision and as part of a larger team.




 Extensive knowledge of competitive offerings, market trends, economic conditions, and the regulatory environment.




 A valid driver's license and access to a vehicle, to meet clients and prospects within the designated district.


 What’s in it for you?

 An entrepreneurial culture with the freedom to develop your career.




 A fast-paced, flexible work environment where you can set your own hours and meet clients when and where it’s convenient for them.




 A compensation structure that rewards growing and maintaining your client base.




 Access to leading-edge resources to support your growth including dedicated marketing support, powerful mobile technology, leading CRM, portfolio, and financial planning software.




 The ability to build long-lasting client relationships through exceptional advice and service.




 Ability to provide an excellent client experience without going to the branch.




 A partnership with our branches and access to Scotia Global Asset Management to deliver an exceptional client experience.




 A work culture that promotes diversity, respect, and inclusion.


 Other Information
 Please note that the compensation structure for this role is base plus variable pay. This is a mobile role and will require frequent travel.

 About the role


 What your role will be… Senior Financial Advisor  At Scotiabank we help employees build their futures – where they can be themselves, and win together. With a commitment to diversity and inclusion and a performance-oriented culture that includes coaching, learning, and development – there are endless possibilities. At Scotiabank – you can make an impact. You help make the futures of our 25 million customers happen. You can find your future here.  What you’ll be doing…
 Our Advisors are customer-centric and able to connect with people in a relatable way. As an essential member of the Canadian Banking Branch network, our focus is to provide exceptional service throughout the customer’s journey by:

 Taking a proactive approach to discovering our customer needs, listening to understand what they are asking for
 Educating our customers, providing relevant insights and expert advice
 Building our customer’s comprehensive plans using a holistic approach to help them achieve their goals
 Nurturing strong, long-standing relationships
 Developing, retaining and growing the branch business by delivering against individual and team sales goals that support a positive customer experience

 What you need to succeed…

 The appetite and drive to build strong customer relationships
 A strategic mindset to develop personalized financial strategies including day-to-day banking, investments and borrowing solutions
 The proven ability to meet and exceed sales targets in a fast paced environment that align to a customer’s stated goals
 A Mutual Funds licence and completed CIFP Diploma

 What we’re offering…

 The opportunity to join a forward-thinking organization where you are surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers.
 A competitive compensation and benefits package.
 An organization committed to making a difference in our communities– for you and our customers.
 You can expect to be recognized and rewarded for high-performance. You’ll be supported by leadership through meaningful development conversations that enable faster advancement and internal training to support your growth and development.
 You’ll receive clear, transparent criteria to progress in your career.
 You won’t need to wait for a vacancy in your branch or move to another branch to elevate your career. You can do it from the same chair enabling you to build deeper relationships and grow your expertise.
